b17ece61de84a1e565ab6a2648856af7e4047253: The expert totally saws Katja Nyberg's argument
efd290df07fed2fa1fcd561d62dbc2d4f5401711: On Friday, Katja Nyberg took part in the newspaper Kvartal's Friday interview. In the podcast, she says that the Swedish Transport Agency revoked her driver's license because they found a metabolite of cocaine, i.e. a chemical residue, and that it is "not an active substance". - Then the question is how it got into my body, says Nyberg. When asked how the residual product could have arisen, she replies: - I have not taken any cocaine. I deny wrongdoing. Nyberg's lawyer has previously used a similar argument. "For an unknown reason, a rapid test gave a result for cocaine, but only for the metabolite and not the narcotic substance," the lawyer wrote in a letter to the Swedish Transport Agency, which TV4 previously reported on. Swedish Medical Examiner's Office: Can only occur if you take cocaine Jimmy Blomqvist Larsson, press officer at the Swedish Medical Examiner's Office, dismisses the reasoning completely. Benzoylecgonine, i.e. the residual product you measure to see if someone has taken cocaine, is classified as a narcotic in itself. If you test positive for that, you are automatically guilty of a drug crime, even if it is not the active substance, he says. In addition, he says that if the metabolite is present in the blood, it always means that you have taken cocaine. - If you've had it in your body, you've had cocaine in your body, says Jimmy Blomqvist Larsson. If benzoylecgonine is found in the body, can it be equated with having used cocaine? - Yes. Could this metabolite occur in some other way than if you took cocaine? - No. Became a political wild It was in the intervening days that Katja Nyberg was stopped by the police after a game accident. The police found a bag of white powder, and she has since been investigated for drunk driving and drug offences. At the end of January, the Swedish Transport Agency revoked her driver's license after drugs were detected in the test results. She has been dismissed from several heavy assignments and became a political wild after the scandal. Katja Nyberg has previously worked as a police officer and was the Sweden Democrats' spokesperson on police issues. During

0d456ad81dd4a0dad049e3fe425ea57c0bf3142e: More cases of winter sickness are now being reported in Sweden. The number is expected to continue to increase, according to the Public Health Authority.   - It is quite likely that the peak has not been reached, but it is difficult to know. The vast majority do not seek care for the symptoms and then not everyone is included in the statistics, says Acting State Epidemiologist Erik Sturegård. The winter sickness is caused by calicivirus which is highly contagious and resistant. Hand sanitizer is not enough and it takes a very small amount of the virus to make you sick. - It can also withstand dehydration, which means that you can become infected long after you have come into contact with it.  Easy to confuse with food poisoning Erik Sturegård believes that mouth protection is only recommended if you are exposed to large amounts of viruses, such as in healthcare. A common mistake is to mistake winter sickness for food poisoning. - There are similar symptoms, but with food poisoning you get sick right away and then quickly get well again. But it can be difficult to know, and therefore one should not take chances but assume that it is winter sickness.  The risk of infection is particularly high for families with small children and specifically when cooking. - If you get sick, it is very important that you do not cook for others. If you have sick children, it is important that they stay at home for at least 48 hours after the last bout of vomiting and diarrhoea. More cases than last year The latest increase in cases is in line with the Public Health Agency's forecast. At the moment, the numbers are higher than compared to last year and it is difficult to say when the spread can conceivably slow down.  - It is possible to work to bring the numbers down if we are meticulous about hygiene. The spread usually takes place over a relatively long period and it is greatly influenced by the efforts we make.

b8f9b185bafd43fafbb867fa49da256349b95839: So much more expensive is over-the-counter in stores: "Remarkable"
99ac5cac4614b522843b4b01cdc73957c979c9aa: Prisjakt's recent survey includes 557 price comparisons between four large pharmacy chains with both physical stores and online shopping. The result shows that almost all non-prescription products are cheaper online – only 19 products had the same price in both channels. In some cases, the price in store can be more than four times as high as online.  - I think it is very important that everyone knows this big price gap between pharmacy products online and in stores so that you can make a good purchase decision, says Isabella Ahmadi. Big differences between products Among the products that stand out the most in terms of percentage are migraine medicine and medicine for heartburn. A pack of migraine tablets can, for example, cost SEK 20 online but SEK 95 in a store, a difference of 375 percent. Even common medicines such as paracetamol and ibuprofen can be significantly more expensive in stores, especially if they are less well-known brands. Price differences in percentage: When it comes to price differences in kronor, it is above all fever thermometers and food supplements that stand out, as the basic price is already high. For these products, the consumer can save up to SEK 200 by choosing to buy online. Municipal criticism of the change in the law Many smaller towns have been critical of the scrapping of track replacement. In C-controlled Laxå, they want to reintroduce the track change and in Lilla Edet, which is also controlled by the Center Party, they want those who are established to be able to be exempted from the rules. S-controlled Finspång believes that those who have not committed a crime should be given a residence permit immediately. Norsjö's Opposition Councilor Lars-Åke Holmgren (KD) is deeply moved by how the family has been affected by the current migration policy. - You have to look at this with tender reasons, it cannot be that everyone should be deported, he says. It was around 8pm one evening last week that it happened. William says he ran and got his phone to film the fox, which was still waiting outside the house.  - I squat down and then it starts nibbling on my hand, as if it thought I had food. "Not natural" It was the first time William caught the fox, but he was never afraid - even though it nibbled on his leg.  - I know it is not dangerous. In the moment I thought "this must be unique, something that many people don't get to be a part of". When the neighbors heard about the discovery, they were impressed. Some have seen it before and reported it, which William thinks is good. - It is not natural that it is in a residential area and is so close. I would think it is looking for food, which could be a problem. It must be able to fend for itself. The municipality does not intervene Henrik Engström at the forestry unit in the city of Borås has seen the film clips. He believes that it is not unusual for foxes to seek out close to people, but that measures are only relevant if they pose a danger. - It happens from time to time, but we only intervene when it is dangerous. If cats start disappearing, we can look into it.  He believes that the fox's curiosity is due to it having been fed before, which he advises against. - I think someone did it when it was young and charming, that's why it's so close.

Ukraine has launched counterattacks The think tank writes in its latest report that several villages have been liberated in the Dnipro region on the border with Donetsk in southeastern Ukraine. The Ukrainian military analyst Kostyantyn Mashovets, to whom ISW refers, writes on social media that Russia previously achieved certain successes in the area. "However, about a week ago, the Russian advance was severely slowed and almost completely stopped. Ukrainian forces then launched a series of counterattacks," writes Mashovets. The counterattacks are said to have slowed down the Russian offensive and caused several Russian units to withdraw.  "In several sectors, Ukraine managed to recapture villages and push back Russian vanguards up to 9-9.5 kilometers," writes Mashovets.  Despite the successes, Mashovets does not want to call it a counter-offensive, instead he believes that it is about tactical counter-attacks.  Biggest conquest since 2023 The news agency AFP has analyzed ISW's report and believes that Ukraine has reclaimed 201 square kilometers of land, it must have happened between Wednesday and Sunday last week. "The retaken area is almost as large as the Russian gains throughout December and is the largest area that Kiev's forces have retaken in such a short period since the counter-offensive that began in June 2023," writes AFP. The military expert and former lieutenant colonel Jörgen Elfving describes the development as a success for Ukraine.  - It helps to increase the will to resist and that you have something to be happy about. But one should not pull too big gears, there are several sources who believe that it is about local counterattacks, says Elfving. In connection with the release of the video, a glove was found a short distance from Guthrie's home, and on Sunday the FBI announced that it appeared to match the gloves worn by the suspect at the front door. The glove must now be quickly tested for DNA - a process that usually takes about a day. Daughter: "Still Feeling Hope" On the same day the FBI released the information about the glove, Savannah Guthrie posted a social media post pleading with the suspected kidnappers to release her mother Nancy Guthrie. "It's been two weeks since our mother was taken from us, and I just want to say that we still feel hope," says a visibly shaken Savannah Guthrie, and continues: "To whoever took her or knows where she is, I want to say that it's never too late, and you're not lost or alone. It's never too late to do the right thing, and we're here." Savannah Guthrie and her family have pleaded with the suspected kidnapper on several occasions to release Nancy Guthrie. Trump threatens consequences In a brief interview with the New York Post on Monday, US President Donald Trump stated that those who kidnapped Nancy Guthrie will face the "very serious" federal consequences if they do not return her in good condition. Trump also added that he would not be surprised if the Justice Department sought the death penalty. The FBI has previously offered upwards of 100,000 dollars, equivalent to just under a million Swedish kronor, for information that leads to Nancy Guthrie being found and the suspect(s) being arrested. Nancy Guthrie was last seen outside her home in Tucson, Arizona for about 10 minutes

The technology, which is the only one of its kind, is based on the patient's own fat being collected through gentle liposuction. It is then mixed with a bio-ink and printed into implants in the desired shape. Karin Säljö, senior physician and docent in plastic surgery, sees great potential in the technology: - In the past, you only injected back the fatty tissue you took under the skin, which is a rather poor method. Now a way to control both the volume and the shape is possible, she says. Shorter surgery and better recovery According to the researchers at Sahlgrenska, a major advantage of the technology is that the implants consist of the body's own material. This increases the chance of a natural and sustainable result over time. The process is also expected to be significantly faster for larger reconstructions than with today's method, because both liposuction and bioprinting take place at the same time, explains Karin. - The current method can take five, six hours and also involves a long recovery time. The project has been going on for almost a decade, and only now are the researchers ready to take the next step – to begin trials on humans. The hope is that the first patients will be able to undergo surgery already during the year. The initial tests involve small implants being placed in the subcutaneous fat on the upper arm and then analyzed after a few months. Many patients forego reconstruction Not everyone who loses soft tissue chooses to have it reconstructed.  Within the Breast Cancer Association, there are today women who refrain from reconstructive surgery, even though many would really like to recreate their breast. That's what Susanne Dieroff Hay, president of the Breast Cancer Association, tells us. - Reconstruction is very important for many breast cancer patients, but many wish there were ways to recreate a breast that entail fewer complications, she says. e2cd6d9b5ac7621af3aa4b3f0a2b268937acd0b7: The prosecutor's concern in the pimping mess: "There could be more"
cf0a95dd136399c6d8392a539c433b3dd35ead69: A man in his 60s has been in custody since the end of October last year on suspicion of having forced his wife to sell sexual services to over 120 people. - It was the plaintiff himself who contacted the police at the end of October last year, says chamber prosecutor Ida Annerstedt. The man and the woman are from Kramfors in Västernorrland county, and the man has previously been convicted of violent crime.  How is the woman today? - I don't want to go into that. The concern: "There could be more" The man is suspected on probable grounds of gross pimping. The suspected sex trade must have been going on since December 2023, and the meetings must have taken place both physically and via the internet. The crimes are said to have taken place in Västernorrland County as well as in other parts of Sweden, and several suspected sex buyers have been identified. - Within the framework of the suspicion of pimping, it is primarily physical encounters that are investigated, says prosecutor Ida Annerstedt.  Several of the suspected sex buyers will probably be charged with aggravated pimping. - Other suspected sex buyers will not be covered by this prosecution, but they may be prosecuted later in parallel or separately in their own investigations, says Ida Annerstedt. Risking several years in prison Ida Annerstedt says that she has not been part of such an extensive investigation regarding pimping before, and the risk is that there are more perpetrators who have not yet been identified. - There could be more, absolutely. Investigation is still ongoing. The state of evidence against the man and some of the suspected sex buyers is assessed as good.  - There is, among other things, things that were found in the phones, and then there is also other written evidence and the oral material. There is another type of technical evidence, but a preliminary investigation is ongoing and preliminary investigation confidentiality prevails. The man denies any wrongdoing. If convicted, he faces several years in prison. - It is a bit difficult to say exactly, but it is at least two years according to the penalty scale in any case, says Ida Annerstedt.

f343e2200541223140ff6abf488eee2dcdebd6d7: This year's winter is significantly colder than last year's and the National Museum of Natural History, which continuously measures the pollen levels in the air, has noted this year that the pollen season has been shifted by a full month compared to last year. Despite that, pharmacies have started to see an increase in the sale of allergy medicine and that many are starting to notice symptoms. How is it possible with pollen in freezing temperatures? One explanation is that pollen gets here with southerly winds from parts of Europe where hazel has already started to bloom, says Agneta Ekebom, pollen expert at the museum. What causes the early pollen season? Climate change has generally led to warmer winters. This means that the pollen season is brought forward when the flowering occurs earlier and earlier. Longer and more intense Liselott Florén at the Asthma and Allergy Association says that the pollen season has also become longer and more intense. How many are allergic? According to the site Pollenkoll, a quarter of the population is allergic to pollen. Liselott Florén says that the number of allergic people in the Western world is increasing.  Florén mentions the two main reasons why it is increasing in the Nordics. When you are exposed to pollen for a longer period of time, the risk of becoming allergic increases. And as the climate down on the continent changes, other types of pollen move up towards northern Europe. Among other things, it concerns wormwood ambrosia, which is very allergenic. It grows in Central Europe and is now beginning to reach our latitudes, she adds. Equip the medicine cabinet What does the pollen season look like in the future? For those who are allergic to hazelnuts, it is good to pay attention to the forecasts and equip the medicine cabinet already now, says Liselott Florén. According to Pollenkoll, hazel is closely followed in time by alder. Next to each other come elm, aspen, birch and willow. Further into the spring comes oak and grass. During the summer, gray nests finally arrive.

In a new Netflix documentary, we get to see the dark side of the program.  - It was much worse than what I remembered when I was younger, when I watched it, says Ellinor Bjurström about the documentary, who herself participated in "Top Model Sweden" ten years ago. Ellinor Bjurström was 18 years old when she was in the Swedish edition of the program. - I have a bit of a love-hate relationship with that time because Top Model Sweden changed my life so incredibly much in many different ways, she says. "Had to stand there in pornographic clothes" There are many events in the program that Ellinor Bjurström finds it hard to think back on. - I remember a photo shoot where we were a girl and a boy as a couple. Then one would be dominant and one submissive. Then we got there and were supposed to wear porn clothes. I was supposed to be submissive so I had to stand there in the porn clothes on all fours against a wall and he was holding a whip, she says. She says that she was far from alone in expressing that several situations were uncomfortable. - But what you forget is that we are there because it is our dream to become models and work with this. We listen to people we look up to and who know the industry. When they say that this is the way it is, you just have to do it or you have to leave, then you swallow your own opinions and feelings and get through it, she says. "It's a shame that I didn't dare to speak up more" When she thinks back to that time today, she wants to give her younger self a hug. - Right then and there, I think it's very sad that I didn't dare to speak up more, while at the same time I feel that I understand myself. I'm strangely proud that I got through it, she says. She says that much of the program was about provoking reactions. - I was, for example, one of those who had little county
e2d1d8706f6a5c73e70f1da2d066329b7b23539b: On social media, wife Luciana writes about his passing: "Yesterday we said goodbye to my beloved husband, dear friend and one of the greatest actors of our time. Bob passed away peacefully at home, surrounded by love and security."  Duvall was born in 1931 in San Diego and began acting in theater in New York during the 1950s. Among his classmates who studied under acting guru Sanford Meisner were Dustin Hoffman and Gene Hackman, among others. Collaboration with Coppola There was a long-term collaboration with the director Francis Ford Coppola. Robert Duvall starred in his "Never Love a Stranger" from 1969, in his first two "Godfather" films and also in "Apocalypse now" where Duvall's character is the one who utters the famous line "I love the smell of napalm in the morning". For the role of Lieutenant Colonel Bill Kilgore, he was nominated for an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor. He was awarded an Oscar in 1984 for his leading role in the western film "På nåd och onåd". After receiving the coveted statuette, he was considered to be affected by the "Oscar curse" and no longer received such interesting offers - while demanding a hefty fee for his efforts. This led, among other things, to him not being allowed to return to the role of Tom Hagen in "The Godfather III" in 1990. Coppola himself told this in the commentary track when the film was released on DVD. Oldest ever During the 1990s and 2000s, an increasingly aged Duvall made many memorable contributions in film and television. Among other things, he received a Golden Globe for his role as Josef Stalin in the TV movie "Stalin". In 2015, at the age of 84, he became the oldest actor ever to be nominated for an Oscar for best supporting actor in the film "The judge". However, the record was broken by Christopher Plummer a few years later. Robert Duvall was married four times, but never had any children. He was active almost to the end, starring in two films released in 2022. Robert Duvall turned 95.

2cc1defc9f1b005c1859024930ea31e18bceed8d: Jurors, judges and prosecutors dress more and more casually in the courtroom, according to lawyer Kristofer Stahre.  - They dress terribly badly. I have sat in cases where the client is accused of serious crime and where jurors come in wearing Iron Maiden t-shirts, he says in Nyhetsdagen. He believes that the attire risks undermining confidence in the legal process.  - You shouldn't dress shabby when judging people's lives and this seems to be a huge problem for both judges and prosecutors. I've had prosecutors come into the courtroom wearing thick sweaters with holes in them, says Stahre. - It sends signals that "I don't care" when you come in dressed like a homeless person. The solution: Suits As a solution, Stahre suggests that Sweden introduce uniforms, so-called coats, for legal actors - a system that already exists in Norway and Denmark, among others.  - It is something that is very wrong when news anchors on TV4 are more formally and stylishly dressed than judges and prosecutors who have to handle murders, he says in Nyhetsdagen. - As you probably know, people decide what they think of a person in just a few seconds, so I think it is important for trust in the judicial system that you dress completely and cleanly.

f576a89fbf1936b65a108dc61410d3fad87c7134: The bitter cold is leaving - then milder weather is expected
263dbcd179e7328111e89953ec556cd48c69c7de: In the last month, an unusually severe cold has been over the whole of Sweden with very low temperatures. But at the weekend, the turn comes. A low pressure with snow and rain moves in over the southern parts of the country. In connection with this, the temperatures can go from many minus to a few plus degrees.  - What is happening this week is that the high pressure is starting to weaken and the weather is changing to a large extent, says Madeleine Westin.  Finland gets to take over the cold The long-term high pressure that has kept the cold air is now being pushed east towards Finland, which means that milder air can make its way over Sweden.  - Then moister air from the Atlantic can enter and provide milder weather, says Madeleine Westin.  This means a temporary interruption in the cold mode. In Götaland and possibly also parts of Svealand, temperatures can reach several plus degrees. Can produce large masses of water. There is no question of any more extensive or long-lasting heat. - However, the prognosis is still quite uncertain, says Madeleine Westin. When the weather gets warmer, the snow that has been in the country for a long time can have major effects.  - The cover can bring with it both slippery road conditions and large masses of water when the snow melts.
e17288e7d7f2c2ba8da0717cac66bedab7843fc6: Here the minister takes off with the electric plane: "I'm shocked by how quiet it is"
30e64260625d521f799df27741feeffd2a63491a: On Monday, several types of electric aircraft were displayed at Bromma Airport in western Stockholm. One of those who was there to look at the aircraft was Infrastructure Minister Andreas Carlson (KD). He describes e-flight as a "game changer" for the transport sector and accessibility in Sweden. - I think it is important to see that electric flight is not science fiction that lies far into the future, but that we are on the brink of a breakthrough. Then you need to prepare both the infrastructure and the regulatory framework in order to draw out the opportunities that exist for the transformation of aviation. "It's the draft you hear" During the visit, the minister took the opportunity to take a flight down to Drottningholm in an American cargo plane. It can take upwards of half a ton of cargo, and the producer will also develop a smaller passenger plane for five passengers. - It was a great experience, and you are struck by how quiet it is. It's the draft you hear. Currently, there is no commercial air traffic with electric aircraft, and Andreas Carlson also does not know when it is realistic to count on there being regular traffic in Sweden. - The developers must be responsible for the technical development in detail, but my view is that politics needs to ensure that it does not fall behind, says Andreas Carlson. Not worried about the batteries The Nordic countries have taken the initiative to develop the regulatory framework to enable electric flight lines in and between the countries. It would not only be better for the climate - but also cheaper, says Andreas Carlson. - The route we flew cost about 40 bucks in charging. Despite the advantages, there are some question marks surrounding electric flights. Like electric cars, there is a concern that today's batteries are not sufficient for long transports within the country, and there is also concern about how the batteries will withstand the cold. However, Andreas Carlson is optimistic. - The development of battery capacity is fast, so it is important to both prepare and protect the infrastructure. The government sees great potential in this and that would be ok
e27d4306be45d80fb79df6a17c07340c1982aec1: A record number of people apply for an increased return migration allowance
f29174d29ba3a808a9d79477ef4f3d8a279b9d20: On 1 January 2026, the return migration allowance was increased to SEK 350,000 per adult and SEK 25,000 per child. Previously, the levels were 10,000 and 5,000 kroner respectively.  - The grant is aimed at people who voluntarily want to return to the countries they originally come from, said Migration Minister Johan Forssell (M) when the proposal was presented in 2024. In the first month of the year alone, the Migration Agency has received 272 applications, compared to 152 in the whole of 2025. Then only one application was granted. Of this year's applications, 93 came from women and 179 from men. The majority, 170 people, are Syrian citizens.  None have been granted So far, 83 applications have been tried - all have been rejected, new figures from the Swedish Migration Agency show. 55 applicants lacked the right permit and 21 had debts with the Kronofogden or CSN. Others were rejected for other reasons.  According to the Swedish Migration Agency, processing normally takes longer than a month, which may contribute to the figures.  - Checking who has debts with the Kronofogden or CSN is fairly quick and then you get rejected immediately. But to get a positive decision you need to go through several steps, for example visiting the Migration Agency for a conversation, says press communicator Didzis Melbiksis. Forssell: No views Migration Minister Johan Forssell (M) announces that he has no views on how many choose to apply for the grant, as it is voluntary. - The new level came into effect about a month ago, so it is far too early to evaluate it or draw any conclusions, Forssell told TV4 Nyheterna.

44b835bccaa2724c4bdce6f78010a1908b0d8a52: The police arrested a man late Thursday evening on suspicion of multiple rapes. "Seized technical devices" The victim must be a girl who was previously a student at the principal's school, according to information given to TV4 Nyheterna. ac395c9115b0e25a12903c8b57636bccbe246a25: Lova, 7, lives with a congenital heart defect: "It was terrible"
8fcbeb371eac00d4c887d07cb354197ea2a10ec3:
Lova Vesterlund was only two months old when the childcare center noticed that she was not gaining weight. The family was sent to Gävle hospital and after several examinations it was clear that she had a serious congenital heart defect.  - It was terrible. It felt like someone pulled something from under our feet, says Ingela Eriksson, Lova's mother.  For large parts of her life, Lova has been cared for in hospital, and got to meet many hospital clowns, she says in Nyhetsmorgon. In total, she has been operated on four times, with the first operation taking almost twelve hours. Today she has both a pacemaker and a mechanical valve.  - Now I have a pacemaker up here, says Lova and points to her chest.  In 2024, seven children died Despite her congenital heart defect, Lova lives an active life and moves like any seven-year-old – she climbs, plays and is constantly in motion.  - We usually say that she is more wild than tame and joke that it is her pacemaker that is an extra battery and drives her to keep going, says Ingela Eriksson.  Every year around 2,000 children are born in Sweden with congenital heart defects. According to Kristina Sparreljung, secretary general of the Heart-Lung Foundation, survival has improved greatly in recent decades. In 2000, 39 children with congenital heart defects died. In 2024, the number was seven. - This development has been driven by the technological development that made it possible to find children with severe congenital heart defects already during pregnancy. This means that these children can be received in prepared operating units, says Kristina Sparreljung. "Live now, die later" She states that research has progressed, among other things through the possibility today to see children's hearts in three-dimensional images - something that was not possible just a few years ago. At the same time, there are continuing challenges. 

- Children with congenital heart defects suffer to a greater extent than other adults from other cardiovascular complications earlier in life, says Kristina Sparreljung.  Lova likes to take her medicine with a little vanilla ice cream

I was initially supposed to go through the program "My midwife" which is regionally funded in Stockholm, but was denied a home birth through them as late as week 38 due to a theoretical deviation, which was known about since week 20. We are so grateful and really wish that all women who want and can have the opportunity to have a home birth," she continues.

c74f6fff68a3dfc507a5353b00f29f186d8f2e04: Imprisoned children are proposed to be locked up for a maximum of 11 hours
ce50924738c50215c81f527996225f73cd07ee36: At the beginning of July, the criminal age for serious crimes will be lowered to 13 years and at the same time the new youth prisons will also be in operation.  A long series of special rules adapted to children will be introduced, among other things, provisions will be introduced on "the best interests of the child".  Detained children must also have the right to be heard and the child's views must be taken into account. This does not mean that the incarcerated children themselves can decide on the enforcement, but their best interests and the opinions they express must be taken into account.  "It's important that we invest in education" Another thing is that young people and adults should be kept apart. It is an important measure to prevent young people from being schooled into more serious crime.  Just like adults, young people will be covered by the Prison Act's employment obligation, but it will mainly consist of education.  - It is important that we invest in education. It's about which children we want to get out after serving their sentence, says Martin Melin, justice policy spokesperson for the Liberals.  Each inmate must have an individual plan with a focus on education and relapse prevention treatment. The plan must be drawn up by the Correctional Service in close cooperation with social services and the guardian. More right to contact with family In many parts, the regulations that apply to adult inmates will also apply to incarcerated children. However, a number of other adaptations to the legislation are proposed, to ensure that enforcement is adapted to children's special needs and rights. A rule is introduced in the Prison Act that children's right to maintain contact with their family must be taken into account in particular in matters of visits and other contacts. The purpose is, among other things, to reduce the risk of adverse effects of the deprivation of liberty. In 2025, there were 259 people aged 15-18 who were sentenced to closed youth care at the State Board of Institutions SIS. If current laws had been in force, they would have been sentenced to youth prison instead, according to the government office's assessments. In the future, there will be more people because

5574b7407583af0661ea11b3051b3dcc402e0ac0: Big test: Here is the worst dog food
e00ca607482ad750df670a71fae0e05d9b3baab3: Since the dog is recommended to eat the same thing every day, it is important that the feed should give the dog everything it needs in terms of nutrition and energy. Råd and Rön have tested 21 types of complete food for adult dogs and the amount of protein, carbohydrates, minerals and fatty acids has been checked, among other things. Worst in test Three products end up at the bottom because of too low a nutritional content. Magnusson adult and Doggy original both had too little methionine. The latter brand and Coop Xtra dog food contain too little vitamin A. - Coop Xtra and Doggy have cereal as the first ingredient. Those that have it as the first ingredient end up at the bottom of our table, that they have a slightly lower nutritional content, says Anna Edberg, responsible for food tests at Råd & Rön.  However, at the bottom of the list is Petgood dog adult insect based, which is one of two products containing insects. Both fare well nutritionally, but Petgood stands out negatively. Namely, the feed contains high levels of glycoalkaloids, which can form in poorly handled potatoes and which can be toxic to the dog.  - This one contains high levels of these poisons, says Anna Edberg in the news morning.  Petgood writes to TV4 Nyhetsmorgon that measures have been taken to ensure low levels of glycoalkaloids and that no dogs have been found to be ill so far.   Big differences in price The price differences are big and the kilo price for the tested products varies between SEK 18 and 225. The price difference partly depends on which ingredients the feed contains, where meat and animal products are often more expensive. While different cereals are cheaper.  See which dog food tops the list in the clip below.

08063da11814b4ce619b4afec90cdf7fc9740567: New study: Ministry of Health understated death toll in Gaza
e92e36ee4b095225361434fd16595a83c95b953c:
The study is based on a survey of 2,000 families in Gaza, selected to represent the population. The researchers tallied both direct and indirect deaths between the terrorist attack on Israel on October 7, 2023 and January 5, 2025. In total, 42,200 women, children and the elderly died in attacks – 56 percent of the direct deaths. The study also shows that the Ministry of Health's reporting on the proportion of women, children and the elderly among the dead has been correct. Fewer indirect deaths The researchers estimate that 3-4 percent of Gaza's population has been killed in the conflict. A further 8,000 people are believed to have died indirectly from, for example, diseases or malnutrition, according to the study.  Researcher Michael Spagat has been working on calculating deaths in conflicts for twenty years.  He questions an earlier study, also published in the Lancet, which showed that the indirect deaths were far more than the direct ones – probably around four times as many.  - In Gaza, there were initially resources in the form of trained doctors and a functioning health system. In addition, the area is small, so once help arrives it can be quickly distributed, says Spagat. May never get answers Data on death tolls have been disputed. An Israeli security source recently said the Gaza health ministry's figures are "largely correct". The Department of Health now states that over 71,660 people have been killed directly by Israeli attacks, including more than 570 after the October 2025 ceasefire. Other studies have reached similar conclusions, but some have estimated even more indirect deaths and a greatly reduced life expectancy. The researchers behind the Lancet study believe that it will take a long time before there is a complete picture of the death toll.

- It is not a given that there will be a large research project to reconstruct what actually happened. It will take a long time before we get a full account of all the dead in Gaza, if we ever get it, says Michael Spagat.

At the same time, she emphasizes that diplomacy is still the president's first option. - I will not set any deadlines for the president. Diplomacy is always his first option, but military action remains on the table. Agree on guiding principles On Wednesday, senior security advisers gathered in the White House to discuss the situation, according to a source with access to information. Even then, Trump is said to have been updated with what was said in the indirect talks that were recently held with Iran in Geneva. The indirect talks between the US and Iran continued for several hours. According to Iran's chief negotiator, the parties agreed on some guiding principles, but US officials say many details remain before any settlement can be reached. At the same time, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt states that Iran is expected to present a more detailed proposal within the coming weeks. At the same time, it is unclear whether the US is patient enough to wait for the proposal before a possible military decision is made. Israel may participate According to Israeli sources to Axios, Israel may also participate in a possible attack on Iran. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio is expected to travel to Israel on February 28 to inform Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu about the negotiations and the current situation. Several Arab states have reportedly tried to dissuade the United States from a military intervention out of fear that the entire region will be further destabilized. At the same time, new satellite images show that Iran is strengthening protection around several important nuclear facilities, according to the US

9d9dfaa3d5f9d7c3dd273708307fe624dc043c4f: Pharmacies are booming again in rural areas - there is a lack of pharmacists
02c9ede35b40a177a2d58f2d88cbee879dd61fb4:
The background to the closure in Hova is above all the lack of pharmacists, i.e. drug managers, but also a failing customer base. According to the Dental Care and Pharmaceutical Benefits Agency, four of the 14 pharmacies that closed last year were the only ones in the town. At the same time, the number of pharmacies in urban areas has increased. Unequal access to medicines Sweden's Pharmacists believe that rural areas do not get equal access to medicines and want to make the profession more attractive.   - The shortage of pharmacists in pharmacies has long been challenging. It is not considered attractive to work in a pharmacy because of the conditions and the working environment. You and I, we need our medicines and if there aren't pharmacists with pharmaceutical expertise out there, we won't get them and that's worrying, says Annika Hage Nederström, head of negotiations at Sveriges Farmaceuter. The government wants to strengthen the pharmacy market In a written statement to TV4 Nyheterna, Social Affairs Minister Jakob Forssmed agrees that the shortage of pharmacists is a challenge, especially in sparsely populated areas. He emphasizes that the government is working with several tools to strengthen the pharmacy market and raise the status of the profession.

In Hova, many are worried about the development.   - There are many important things that have disappeared. For example, we had three banks when I moved here. Now there is nothing. And real mail doesn't exist either, says Usko Punnönen, Hovabo.   - And now no pharmacy.   - No, exactly yes. That too. That it disappeared. I miss it a lot actually, he says.

The Russian man has been detained since his arrest. Säpo also carried out the house search and several items were seized, including mobile phones. Russia demands a meeting with the man The incident has also received attention in Russia, where, among other things, the Russian state-controlled news agencies Tass and Ria Novosti highlighted the incident. Russia's ambassador to Sweden, Sergey Belyayev, has also spoken about the case to Russian media and insists that the embassy should be allowed to meet the man.  - We are aware of the case, we are in contact with the Russian citizen and his relatives and are insisting to the Swedish side that our consular officials should be allowed to meet him, Beljajev tells Tass. In a statement, the embassy questions whether the man will receive any consular support.  Säpo does not want to comment on the restrictions that apply to the detained man. - Regarding the law and possible restrictions, we refer to the prosecutor, says Säpo's spokesperson Jonathan Svensson. In the documents from the district court, it does not appear whether the man has been imposed any special restrictions during the time he is in custody. During Tuesday, TV4 Nyheterna contacted prosecutor Lars Hedvall about the embassy's claim.  The government must make a decision on extradition While waiting for the government, the Supreme Court and the attorney general to approve the extradition to the United States, the district court chose to detain the man. e5048bbf87cd99c2f6532f4136ea1e4391ca851e: Right-wing activist beaten to death - used as propaganda
c2c259a60ea764bc269cba8b53e27b7f6ffb1134: Right-wing activist Quentin Deranque, 23, was beaten to death by left-wing extremists in connection with a far-right demonstration in the French city of Lyon on Thursday. The incident has triggered a political crisis in the country, and gained great importance within the far-right movement. Video clips show six masked people attacking three people lying on the ground. Two manage to escape, but Quentin Deranque stayed behind and was badly beaten. He later died in hospital as a result of his injuries. The autopsy showed fatal injuries to his skull and brain. Support from far-right groups After the death, nationalist and far-right groups around Europe, including Sweden, Denmark and Germany, portrayed him as a martyr and paid tribute to him. They use the event for propaganda purposes, to mobilize support and to recruit new members, says Christer Mattsson, researcher at the University of Gothenburg. - It is a matter of course for these groups to stand up for people who belong to their own environment and who in this case have lost their lives, says Christer Mattsson. - National borders are not really that interesting to them, but what is important is whiteness. That white people stick together racially and culturally, he continues. Want to avenge the murder On social media there are also discussions about revenge for the 23-year-old's death and calls to find the culprits.  - Violence is seen as a means of seizing power, but it also has the ideological component that it separates the strong from the weak. Through violence also comes sacrifice. In Sweden, among others, White Boys Sweden and Aktivklubb Sweden have honored Deranque on social media. White Boys Stockholm has also held a demonstration for the victim. "White man, fight back", and "Justice for Quentin" are some of the posts. "Quentin is with us," the group writes in a post. Want to avenge the murder Martyrdom Mattsson explains that martyrdom is deeply rooted in the far-right movement. –

1de26a4b4e920acc3cc3cf7014bf96ae65d7a782: Want to see snowball fights at recess - for the sake of the children's health
9c7f25acf02cc7215d3df47b5c8a038b84191f75: Snowball fights during school breaks have long been debated - now the Swedish Sports Teachers Association wants that and wrestling to be allowed, which SVT was the first to report. The association believes that it is important for children's motor skills and coordination, while at the same time it prevents bullying.  - You can sprain a foot, but a foot heals. Missed training in courage, reciprocity and trust can probably leave bigger scars, says Jennie Nobelius, president of the Swedish Sports Teachers' Association.  Support from research In Sweden, it is the municipalities and schools that decide what is permitted and the Swedish National Agency for Education has no general recommendation. Snowball fights are prohibited at Skanskvarnsskolan in Stockholm.  - The children can play in other ways. There is a difference between a home environment and a school environment, we have responsibility for the children's safety and security, says the school's principal Ingrid Gustavsson. Rune Storli, docent at Queen Maud's University in Trondheim, has researched risky play and believes that it is an important part of children's exploration.  - It is a good arena for developing social skills and learning about boundaries. It's like the Astrid Lindgren quote: "he who is very strong must also be very kind". He refers to studies that show that children who are allowed to play risky develop social skills more easily.  - When children do not meet physically in wild play, they lose an important dimension of how to learn to be social. Even animals play in this way. "Arguments happen all the time" The Swedish Sports Teachers' Association believes that excessive protection can inhibit children's development.  - We are creating a bubble wrap society where safety replaces development in the children, says Jennie Nobelius.  Ingrid Gustavsson does not share the image that children are protected too much and questions how snowball fights should counter bullying.  - I find it difficult to see how wrestling or snowball fights could achieve what we want to achieve within the school. Jennie Nobelius sees conflicts as part of learning, if it takes place under the supervision of adults.  - Ordinary quarrels happen all the time and conflict management is a must
f002794e942b2b129dc338d1bf4aa0d4f6fe3a86: The hair started to burn - Marie about the viral accident in the candle shop
fd9166be356724c91e211a715953018aa6175be7:
It was last Friday, the unlucky day the 13th, that it happened. Marie Söderberg bent over to pick among candles when her large tuft of hair ended up in a heat lamp and caught fire. Neither she nor the customer in the store noticed anything. It was only when a colleague saw the flames and shouted her name that the situation became serious.  "I didn't notice it was on fire" The colleague's shout made her react.
 
- I thought: Where the hell is that coming from? And then I looked in the mirror – yes! Then it was just a matter of turning it off quickly, she says. Even though it burned badly, Marie did not suffer any damage to her skin. However, she had to say goodbye to part of her hair, and to the big tassel she used to have. - It might say something about how much hair I actually have, although you can't see it now. It has become less. I lost some, says Söderberg. Caught on film The incident was caught on the store's surveillance camera and the clip has spread quickly on social media. When Marie and her colleagues saw the film afterwards, they were shocked by how powerful the flames were, but today they can laugh about it. The fact that it was also Friday the 13th is not something she missed.

 - If you are shocked, you can think about whether it had anything to do with the case or not, she says with a laugh. Today, she is most grateful that it all, thank God, ended well. Now Marie would like to remind others to be careful with candles.
f18960b1ee34373f6e4ce018a1db2bff20e5e0ac: The hotel chain exposed to a cyber attack – information has been leaked
f0c51faae630464db25bb71798349079143fc8a3:
The hotel chain BWH Hotels has 191 hotels in the Nordic region in more than 100 destinations. Now the Best Western chain has been exposed to a cyber attack in which customers' personal data was leaked.  Those affected are customers in Sweden, Denmark and Norway. In recent days, the attackers have come across booking information, email addresses and phone numbers. The chain was alerted to the incident via customer service and the hotel, which raised the alarm. Marketing manager Sara Hallsund cannot answer the exact date of when the attack took place. - We are of course investigating what has happened and what kind of messages are going out. Unfortunately, it is really a big social problem today and now we have also been affected by this, she says. Hallsund cannot answer what extent it is.  - I have no information about it at the moment.  Customers with reservations have received messages on Whatsapp, text messages and emails with a link in recent days. Wants a debit card TV4 Nyheterna has taken note of a message sent via Whatsapp from a confirmed company account. It says the first and last name, as well as the check-in date for the current booking. Then it says that "action is required" and that the booking is not "fully completed". The customer is then prompted to click on a link.

Via the link, the attackers want the customer to confirm their payment card number. The payment card information has not been leaked, according to Sara Hallsund. - So that's what you're trying to fish for, she says.  Exactly what type of attack it is is not yet clear. - We have brought in a data security partner who helps us see what is happening, says Hallsund. "Be vigilant" On Best Western's Swedish website, there is a message at the top of the site. It says: "Your security is important. Be alert for unexpected messages asking for information or payment. Contact the hotel if anything feels suspicious." Why don't you specify that such messages abound on Whatsapp, for example? - We think that you need to be vigilant as an individual in general right now in the community

137a17a5c0d09ca6202d0c51d52e6e92f32e1b91: The Minister of Foreign Affairs does not rule out nuclear weapons in Sweden
4a52a8a3a5041983be4b0007a4c54f0c0cae874c: On Wednesday, the Sweden Democrats opened up to the possibility that nuclear weapons may have to be placed in Sweden even in gray zone situations - between war and peace. The party's foreign policy spokesperson Aron Emilsson believes that the situation Sweden is in is "beginning to resemble" a gray area, something TT reported. Unlike Norway, Sweden has no legal ban on nuclear weapons - and the position is that nuclear weapons should not be in Sweden in peacetime.  Requires broad discussion Sweden's nuclear deterrent lies primarily with the United States - of which Sweden is a part through NATO membership, emphasizes Foreign Minister Maria Malmer Stenergard.  - Then there are important complements in Europe, partly in Great Britain and partly in France. There is a doctrine in Sweden and we have also written in the NATO bill that in peacetime you do not have nuclear weapons on Swedish soil. Malmer Stenergard refers to Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson's statement that Sweden is not at war but not at peace either. At the same time, the nuclear weapons discussion should not be a matter of interpretations, she believes. - If this is to be changed, then there must be a serious discussion within the alliance, between allies in NATO and of course there must also be broad support in the Riksdag. It's not something you change lightly, says Malmer Stenergard and adds that a discussion should also be held with the Nordic countries. Serious situation She does not rule out that the issue may need to be reviewed, but emphasizes that it requires both national and Nordic anchoring.  - Actually, I don't think you should rule anything out when we have such a serious security policy situation in Europe and a war in our immediate area. There is a lot that we didn't think would happen that has happened in a fairly short time, says Malmer Stenergard.

d0c5811fc7f2153a36938b1431f5bc017d94fad9:
By all accounts, the pressure on Ukraine is now increasing, even though US envoy Steve Witkoff expresses himself positively about the state of negotiations. The American president is fickle, but lately his statements have mostly been about Ukraine needing to be more willing to negotiate and compromise.  While there have been exceptions over the past year, Trump has rarely talked about Russian concessions.  The common thread has nevertheless been that it is President Zelensky who should understand his and his country's best interests and end the war even if it means enormous concessions.

As two days of talks ended in Geneva today, it was clear that both the Russian and Ukrainian delegations were of the same opinion: that the deliberations had been difficult.  Both sides said the parties will meet again, but no dates were announced. The outside world had not expected a breakthrough, but perhaps some details have become clearer to those involved beyond the media noise surrounding the meetings. The war is far away for the Americans In a week, Ukraine commemorates the fallen on the anniversary of four years of war. No other war in Europe since the Second World War has shaken the continent like Russia's large-scale invasion in 2022. The fate of Ukraine is constantly on the agenda when Europe's politicians meet and has had far-reaching consequences for security policy, defense budgets and people's view of the future on our continent.  At the same time, war is now everyday life for Ukrainians, Europeans and perhaps Americans. Why do I write "maybe"? Well, because the war has always been far away for the Americans. "Has his legacy to think about" Therefore, it is not just Trump's pursuit of the peace prize or a general impatience that explains why he wants to quickly end the war - possibly as early as the summer, as it is claimed.  Many Americans do not understand how Ukraine concerns them, and Trump has both his aftermath and the November midterm elections on his mind.  From this perspective, one can see T

At the same time, the radio station NRJ loses its licence. - This is a shock message that we find difficult to take in. We are both sad and upset. 1.5 million listeners will lose their radio station and our employees risk losing their jobs, says NRJ CEO Richard Mazeret in a press release. NRJ has been broadcast for 33 years in Sweden - and is the only commercial radio station that increased its listenership figures in 2025. - We are the only actor that is growing. At the same time, the license is instead given to a completely unproven actor with no experience in radio, and who also increases the media concentration in Sweden. This makes the Media Authority's decision very difficult to understand, says Richard Mazeret.  The explanation: "There are only three permits" At the same time, Aftonbladet calls this a historic step. - This is one of our biggest investments in many years, and a clear expression of our ambition to reach more people with journalism in everyday life, says Lotta Folcker, publisher at Aftonbladet to Aftonbladet.  NRJ is forced to stop broadcasting on July 31 this year - and the license passes to Aftonbladet the following day. The media authority believes that they are handing over the license so that Aftonbladet can offer something new to the listeners, as they will have a news focus. - There are only three permits, and if Aftonbladet is to broadcast radio, someone else has to leave. Then we came to the conclusion that it is NRJ that must give way because the frequencies must be used efficiently, says Ola Vigström, a lawyer at the Media Authority to Aftonbladet.  The profile: "We carry on as usual" Sofia Wistam, Anis don Demina and Sebastian "Basse" Widman are all big profiles at NRJ. "It feels boring, of course, but now it's up to us to get as many regional permits as possible so we can continue to be heard in large parts of the country," writes Sebastian "Basse" Widman in a text message to TV4 Nyheterna. d30cabee1c22342ad668be9434a3e4cd9851b387: Therefore, we close our eyes to the dangers on the ice
c6488f3bfd73234aa2163225a262ddf213bb34f4: Over the weekend, at least five people walked through the ice in central Stockholm, despite warnings. And it is a problem all over the country that people go out on the ice without knowledge and safety equipment. What is it that attracts us to take the risk? Per Carlbring, professor of psychology at Stockholm University, believes that it is herd behavior. - I see that others are out and it is precisely this herd behavior that makes you dare to go out. You don't really have a clue yourself, but you think it's proof that it actually works, he says. New perspectives He believes that herd behavior has served humanity. - That is how we have survived. That we have looked at what others are doing. That we don't have to experience everything ourselves to dare to do things. So this particular thing about what others are doing has been very good for us. It seems good to eat watermelon, then I also eat watermelon, says Per Carlbring. Another reason is to see things from a new perspective. - That you can go out and perhaps see your home from a different angle. But think before you go out. It's lovely, but is it worth it? "Getting a shock" You should think about what happens if you fall and what the consequences are. - Would you go for a winter swim on your own? What actually happens in the body? You get a shock and can't really control what happens. You can get a reflex to take a deep breath - and if you do it under water, it will be very bad, warns Per Carlbring. There are few who have actually tried to plur and get back up. - In principle, almost no Swedes have that. And you should actually have that on your track record the same year you consider going out on the ice.

e0530d3ce0ace3c74baec3ecd94a5a603772b6b4: Fewer people are sentenced for bribery - despite more serious crimes
385411ad6efc2109e2841bdf3066d8e68d94c2f5: The total value of the bribery offenses was just over SEK 24 million in 2025. That is greater than the combined value for both 2023 and 2024, according to the report. Within the building and construction industry, it was exclusively serious bribery that took place last year, says Parul Sharma. - I think it's time for this industry to actually get to grips with the matter. We have not seen as many serious bribery crimes gathered in one industry as we have in 2025. It is serious and alarming, she says in Nyhetsmorgon. Nepotism common The average bribery offender is a 51-year-old man working in the private sector. The recipient is also within the same age group, but works in the public sector. - This is often where we see our bribery crimes in Sweden take place. If you look at last year's bribery convictions, we see that in 65 percent of the cases, it is about the exercise of authority, says Parul Sharma. Half of all bribery convictions in 2025 were related to crony corruption or nepotism. - We see a fairly high degree of nepotistic relationships in the serious bribery offences. It is old colleagues, sometimes family members, with whom you do business, says Parul Sharma. "Cash is still king" Bribes usually consist of money, vehicles, pleasure trips and restaurant visits. Renovations are also common – it is used as an indirect payment, explains Parul Sharma. - When we at the institute ask what Swedes think is the most common bribe, people usually say: "Not money, well, that's far too shameful." But cash is still king. Money is still the most common bribe. She believes that the number of darkness is large. - The difficult thing in Sweden is that we are not inclined to blow the whistle or report to the police. The dark figure is enormous. We see fewer convictions, but also alarmingly much worse bribery offences.
9922e1d871131ef424b2e8b0fabdd5d4548818fd: KD below the bar – L left at bottom level
0e209815b29aa26630738caaed6e55d6f7157963: The Christian Democrats lose to 3.8 percent and end up under the Riksdag barrier. The Liberals remain at 2.1 percent - the same level as on two previous occasions, both when Johan Pehrson was newly elected party leader and just before the election of Simona Mohamsson. The survey also shows that none of the governing parties is winning voters. - The most interesting thing is that none of the governing parties win voters. The opposition's lead is increasing, says Torbjörn Sjöström, CEO of Novus. Tough situation for the government side The Moderates stand still at 17.5 percent, while the Sweden Democrats, who are not a government party but are part of the government base, increase slightly to 22.9 percent. According to Sjöström, the development means that Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson has an increasingly difficult path to re-election. - It looks very difficult. SD are very strong right now. The moderates stand and stomp and the support parties would fall out of a government if there were elections today, he says. Sjöström points out that a sitting government is often negatively affected by events in the outside world and by domestic problems. - Anything negative that happens will punish the current government. We have increased electricity prices, for example. SD can sit safely in the back seat, while the opposition benefits from the negative events that take place, he says. Belief in the future is decisive Sjöström believes that the political development in Sweden follows a broader pattern also in other western countries where uncertainty and anxiety dominate. - As the current government throughout the Western world, you are fighting against the negative reality. The most important thing is to try to build in faith in the future. If you succeed in creating hope, it can also give a little more tolerance towards the uncertain present, he says. The changes in the measurement are within the statistical margin of error.
91c94d65d269b5a88051e69db88114c27d59eb99: "Grab my daughter - hid us under the bed"
64475ee888c97aff8a5427ea54570c08f14aa84d: An explosion has occurred in an apartment building in Rinkeby in northern Stockholm. Walls are damaged, several windows have been broken and the gate is destroyed. The exact same gate exploded yesterday, which TV4 Nyheterna reported on. But now the bang was much stronger. Neighbor Oliver: "Don't know how I'm still alive" Oliver lives in the stairwell with his wife and one-year-old daughter. He was sleeping when it struck. He looks out over the facade and says it looks like the war game "Call of Duty". - I don't know how I'm still alive, I was sleeping in the corner there. If you look, you'll see my bed, Oliver tells TV4 news and points. He continues: - I was very tired, because we didn't get any sleep after the explosion yesterday. The next thing that happens is that I see myself grabbing my daughter and we are hiding under the bed. How are you? - I don't know. What are you going to do now? - I have no idea. But I won't stay here. It doesn't work if you get bombed every night. I am from Albania and have seen many bad things there, but to see it in Sweden... I came here because it was a nice country, but my experience has been different. The police appeal for witnesses Daniel Wikdahl, press spokesperson at the police, says that it is "completely understandable" if those who live in the area feel worried. - So it is the same gate and stairwell that have been hit two nights in a row. Last night's blast was much stronger than yesterday's, says Daniel Wikdahl, police spokesperson. The police are now working on mapping evidence. - There is some kind of connection. Which it is, we cannot answer at the moment. The police are on site in Rinkeby during the day with security and crime prevention efforts. - If you know something or have seen something, we want you to call, says Wikdahl. The landlord can change the windows again today Jonas Hagström, security coordinator at Victoriahem, made sure to change all the windows that were destroyed yesterday. Now he needs to repair them again, less than a day late

bc79b7e528a6c433170105bd8dd5f0e232c0332b: Swedish rescue leaders practice - for the worst
ee491b2f993c65a211222c47793b26baa09b326b: In Skövde, the rescue leaders are placed in a simulated war situation where they have to deal with a missile hit against a school. The scenario is based on real events from Ukraine and aims to train on complex and extreme situations that cannot be reproduced on a regular training ground. The virtual environment makes it possible to move freely and interact with both people and the environment. Researchers from the University of Skövde are behind the project. So far, roughly 120 rescue officers around the country have been able to try out the concept, which is based on computer game technology where the situation can be updated in real time depending on which decisions are made. Authentic drone images from Ukraine To increase the realism, authentic drone images from a school in Ukraine are used, where the emergency services inspected the building from the inside using drones. Cecilia Hammar Wijkmark, researcher at the University of Skövde, explains that the project focuses on creating a realistic feeling in the exercise. - We look a lot at what contributes to the feeling of presence, what gives a realistic feeling in this event. It can be everything from the visual elements, sound and interaction with the technology, she says. Provides important experiences Pär Hagbohm believes that although the physical feeling of touching things may be missing, the exercise provides important experiences for the management function. - I think there may be a certain lack of being able to physically touch things. But here we actually isolate the management function of training and decision-making. Here, we get to see so many aspects of this particular thing with the management perspective and leading and making decisions, he says.

65c08f4f60d8ee4e17b7f46b3e28700bad25468f: Dressed up as a lion dancer - caught a thief in the middle of the market
276e6551c5361bcf6124ab0c1736e7cb3a34f217: A video released by Thai police shows colorful lions dancing at a temple market in Bangkok - a familiar sight during New Year celebrations. What the visitors don't know is that two policemen are hiding under the traditional garb, with their eyes fixed on a suspicious man in the crowd.  The person in question is a 33-year-old man who is suspected of breaking into a local police chief on three occasions in the past month. According to the police, valuables to the value of approximately two million baht - equivalent to more than SEK 500,000 - have been stolen.  The video shows how the lion dancers slowly approach the man before suddenly pouncing, wrestling him down and carrying out the arrest in the middle of the market visitors.  Traced amulets The police state that they have previously tried to arrest the man but failed, because he quickly discovered the police and fled the scene.  By tracking stolen amulets he sold, investigators were able to identify him and chart his movement patterns. The investigation revealed that the suspect frequently visited temples in Nonthaburi, leading to the decision to conduct the undercover arrest at a temple market.  No further information about the suspects or upcoming legal process has been released.
304edcb51a465f4e3ff13147d5fe8ff97746e7f8: This is how new mortgage rules should make it easier for young people
009810487a58936ec9d81d94e1fff0427fa68223:
On April 1 this year, there will be new rules on how much you can borrow for a home. Today the ceiling is 80 percent of the home's value, but in April it will be raised to 90 percent. 

- The reason is that they want to make it easier for first-time buyers to enter the housing market. In big cities, hundreds of thousands of kroner can be required in investment, so it is not so easy to enter the housing market, says economics journalist Frida Bratt.  The downside is that people are expected to become more indebted. The house price is affected by the new rules. There will also be new rules about how much you need to amortize. 
- This applies to those who are highly leveraged, i.e. those who have a loan-to-value ratio that is over 70 percent of the home's value and have a loan that is four and a half times higher than their income. So far you have had to amortize three percent, but that is now reduced to two percent, says Frida Bratt.  More expensive apartments The new conditions are expected to have consequences for housing prices, especially for smaller apartments in big cities.
- These are attractive homes for young first-time buyers and these homes could rise in price because more people now have the opportunity to participate in a bidding process, says Frida Bratt.

2e842bc4f5e8d4f0a16b5f7053fba512c68c101d: Dancing and singing at the graves of relatives - in protest against the regime
95e740490afcf82e970795378f7b83e689307156: This week, 40 days have passed since the widespread protests in Iran were bloodily put down by the country's security forces. During the week, memorial services were held across the country for the thousands of protesters who were killed. In several places the commemorations have turned into new protests against the regime where slogans against the regime have been chanted. According to the American think tank CTP-ISW, twelve demonstrations in seven Iranian provinces took place on Tuesday. In the city of Abdanan in northwestern Iran, security forces are reported to have fired at mourners at the burial grounds. But the commemorative ceremonies have this time taken on a new character. Instead of religious rituals, including Koran reading, music, song and dance have taken their place.  In videos of funerals now circulating, mothers and fathers urge others to sing and live, clap and dance.  Grief as political resistance Writer and Iranian exile Atefeh Sebdani calls it "resistance in its strongest form". She explains that it's about relatives refusing to let the state own their grief - and turning it into political resistance.  This in a country where the Islamic Republic has long built its legitimacy on martyrdom and ritualized grief, the symbolic rebellion against grief as a means of power has now become clear, she explains.  - At these funerals and memorial ceremonies that we now see, you can seem to see something as bizarre as a party. But just scratching the surface a little, you understand that this is the strongest act of resistance you can see, says Atefeh Sebdani. Risking their lives But it is also about the wishes of the victims themselves - often young people who risk their lives for democracy. - We have seen testimonies, terribly heartbreaking wills that have come out. Video and audio messages where you call your relatives before going out on the street. Where they say promise you won't grieve me. Promise you'll celebrate. - This is an act that I have been so close to wanting to dig into the history books to see about men

The man was arrested and detained on Wednesday. He had then been active in the environments since at least November 6 last year, according to the prosecutor
6c2fbb22c5cef003e5830b3cbfd1ff390231f04e:
On December 3, 2024, the then president of South Korea gave an unexpected televised speech in which he pointed to threats from North Korea and "anti-state forces".  He declared a state of military emergency, the country's first in four decades, and ordered the military to surround parliament.  Dramatic images of politicians barricading themselves in the parliament building, soldiers trying to storm it and civilians trying to stop armored vehicles were shared around the world.  Six hours The decision was made without political support and within six hours the National Assembly managed to gather and vote to overturn it. The state of emergency lasted for six hours.  The incident sparked mass protests and was described as an attempt to condone Yoon's power.  Ten days later, parliament voted to impeach him. He was immediately suspended and later formally deposed as well. Long investigation The investigation against the former president continued throughout 2025. Yoon has defended his decisions as necessary to protect democracy. Prosecutors have argued throughout that the president abused his power to neutralize political opponents and circumvent the democratic process.  Yesterday he was sentenced by the court in Seoul to life imprisonment for attempted sedition.  Judge Ji Gwi-yeon found that Yoon sent troops to the National Assembly to silence political opponents who opposed his government.  
- The court finds that the intention was to paralyze the congregation for a considerable period of time, he says.  Saying Sorry Yoon Suk Yeol has called the verdict "hard to accept" but has not said if he plans to appeal. It is unclear when the 65-year-old Yoon may become eligible for parole, but lifers can usually apply after 20 years. Today he says sorry.  "I apologize to the people for the frustration and hardship I have caused them as a result of my shortcomings, even though I have always been determined to save the nation," he said in a statement, according to AFP.
8962430ae5561a1adf37f12b4d45bd8eb25b2e89: Warns of the ice on water sources: "I wouldn't have ventured out"
eecab15f6a8c114cd86126619560b63740a44fae: The Delsjö area in Gothenburg is used as the city's raw water reservoir and water is pumped both in and out of the lakes. After weeks of freezing temperatures, the bodies of water are covered by a solid layer of ice, but appearances can be deceiving. Although the ice looks stable, these types of lakes where the water is regulated can be treacherous. - When the water level changes, the ice becomes weaker. It breaks up. Cracks can appear in the ice and therefore the ice can become dangerous, says Anton El Raai, operating engineer for circulation and water within the City of Gothenburg. Like a hammock In Gothenburg, the municipality has specifically warned against entering the Delsjöarna, but this type of regulated lakes can be found all over the country. It is not enough that the ice itself becomes unstable. If water is drained after the ice has formed, a gap of several decimetres can be created between the ice cover and the water surface. - Then it becomes even more dangerous, because then the ice becomes like a hammock above the water and then you can fall if you feel bad, says Kim Loob Almbratt, biologist at Sportfiskarna. This "hammock effect" on the one hand increases the pressure on the ice when the water does not relieve it, and on the other hand the person who falls through risks getting stuck under the ice without the possibility of climbing up. The expert advises against When TV4 meets Kim Loob Almbratt, he and Sportfiskarna are out with a school class showing things you can do on the ice, such as ice fishing. But they are not out on the Delsjöarna, but have chosen another lake in Gothenburg where the ice is stable. - I wouldn't have ventured out on an ice that has a lot of regulation, nor a water source if I'm not absolutely sure that I will be able to handle this. I don't think common people should go out on regulated lakes, says Kim Loob Almbratt.

What we have been talking about is the dictatorship alliance, it is China, Belarus, North Korea and Iran that more or less actively support Russia in the invasion of Ukraine, says Johan Fredriksson.

- So it is an international conflict with many countries involved, he continues. He emphasizes that Zelensky right now needs international support and attention, and that he therefore highlights this in the interview with the BBC. Rejects demands The interview with Zelenskyi was conducted at the government headquarters in Kyiv over the weekend. Russia is demanding that Ukraine hand over the 20 percent of the Donetsk region it still controls, as well as additional areas in Kherson and Zaporizhzhya and several other cities.  Zelenskyy rejects these demands and believes that it is about more than just land. - I see this differently. I don't just see it as land. I see it as us abandoning—weakening our positions, abandoning hundreds of thousands of our people who live there. I am sure that this "retreat" would split our society, Zelenskyy told the newspaper. 79e6bdd67ecc598376f7de2eeb8abf9a446756b8: This is how Klarna enables the purchase of fake pills: "Seemed authentic"
c087651b91848d97e1b1487bae111a0e132aab52: 79-year-old Peter Smedman suffers from severe osteoarthritis. In his feed on Facebook, something appears that looks like a feature from TV4. A man presented as Nyhetsmorgon's employee Mikael "Soldoktorn" Sandström recommends capsules that are claimed to be able to make Peter "completely healthy in a few weeks". - It seemed authentic. So this gave me hope of finding a very flexible solution to my osteoarthritis, says Peter Smedman. When Peter enters the webshop, he sees something that makes him take the step to go ahead and order the capsules.  - Klarna came up as a payment option. As I have used Klarna before, I thought it was very good. It gave some credibility, he says. That, says former prosecutor Stefan Lundberg, is a central part of the scheme. - It's part of the criminal plan, this for the customer to see the Klarna logo and feel safe, just like Peter did here, and not get any idea that this is fraud. "Prison is a normal punishment" Behind the webshops is a Dutch company that is clearly aimed at Sweden - with Swedish-language marketing and Swedish internet addresses. The miracle pills are sold under several names – including Calm X and Leaf Lab.  Kallafakta's review shows that for nine months Klarna acted as a payment intermediary in the fraud. Klarna's actions may be criminal according to several experts who took part in Kalla fakta's research. - It could be money laundering. It can be aiding and abetting fraud, which can also be serious fraud. This means that prison is a normal punishment, says Stefan Lundberg, former chief prosecutor at the Ecocrime Authority. "Strictly prohibited" In the marketing, the capsules are claimed to be able to cure cancer, epilepsy, heart disease and other serious diseases. Claiming that a product cures serious diseases without approval is strictly prohibited. - No, they cannot cure cancer and they are not approved to treat any diseases, says Martin Burman at the Medicines Agency.
