2c6e83eefa6b3cd964be575670bb4b5b35a6213e: In Adolf Hitler's Austrian birthplace of Braunau am Inn, right on the border with Germany, a great debate is taking place. The house where he was born, which has recently been a sheltered workshop for the disabled, was bought by the state in 2016 and is now being renovated to become a police station. Ludwig Laher is a writer and member of the Mauthausen Committee Austria, an organization that draws attention to the Mauthausen concentration camp. He is critical of the plan. - A police station is problematic. The police - and this is not a criticism of them - must protect the interests of the state in any political system. They must therefore simply obey the state. Resistance within the police force is a rare phenomenon, he told AFP. "Understand that you want to avoid people using it as a place of remembrance" Ludwig Laher says that other possibilities have been discussed. - An idea that received a lot of support was a "responsibility house", a place where young people from different parts of the world could develop strategies for peace work, international understanding and peaceful relations between people. German Sibylle Treiblmaier, 53, thinks the situation is like a "double-edged sword". - I think the house could have been used better or differently, and I understand that you want to avoid people using it as a memorial to Hitler. That's how it really was in my youth.

Jalisco Governor Pablo Lemus has urged residents to stay at home.  Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum has also come out and called for calm in an attempt to pour oil on the waves after the cartel leader's death. One of Mexico's Most Wanted Before his death, Oseguera was one of Mexico's most wanted and a $15 million reward for information leading to his capture was announced by the United States. Thankfully, everyone is alive; everyone is now in the hospital, says student Alina Varfolomieva. It appears to be a minor miracle that not more than one person was killed in the attack. Neighbor Anton Babenko is almost speechless. - The roof collapsed on mother, straight into bed in the middle of her sleep. It raged, and on dad too. And then they managed to get out of there. I don't understand anything, I'm in shock, he says. "Take the threat from Moscow seriously" The residents are now wondering when the outside world will help stop Russia.  - We live with hope. We want to stay. We will not leave here. This is our country, says Denis Kozlov. He now wants to warn the rest of Europe: - Take the threat from Moscow seriously. I have decent finances and can even consider taking his legal costs. I am unreserved on the perpetrator's side, said GW Persson at the time. The criticism was not long in coming. Foreign Minister Maria Malmer Stenergard (M) wrote in an X post that he "increasingly showed evidence of a lack of judgment" and "crossed a sharp line". "Now is the time to let GW retire?", wrote SD leader Jimmie Åkesson and believes that GW Persson "trivializes, even encourages threats against politicians". GW: "People can think what they want" Now GW Persson comments on the criticism.  - People can think what they want. Regarding my pension, it is something I will wait for as long as I can, he says. The criminologist believes that the apples outside Johan Forssell's door were not about any threat, but were a legitimate protest against an "unreasonable, racist policy". - It's about children and teenagers being deported to countries they've never been to. When people protest against it, I think it's a sign of health. Considers that Forsell overreacted Reporting the person who left the Hitler apples for illegal threats was an overreaction on the part of Johan Forssell, believes Leif GW Persson. - He who left these apples was completely open about who he was. These goblins don't usually do that. - I have been threatened a lot. If I had received some apples with a mustache at home, I would never have thought of reporting it as a threat. GW also points out that he was one of the few who took Åkesson's side when someone "pushed a certain pastry in his face". He then refers to the incident in 2013 when a woman threw a cake in the SD leader's face and was convicted of molestation. - You can't do that, and that judgment was completely correct, says Leif GW Persson.

b2a98766c02aff492fcc8ce443085cdac37d5291: Garbage dumps grow in Havana as the fuel crisis deepens
9b45dc591bad7600aea70c6ac7dfacf5964d5c75: The situation is a direct consequence of the energy crisis that has worsened since oil deliveries to Cuba were stopped. The country is heavily dependent on imported oil, above all from Venezuela, which has long served as an economic lifeline. Following the US intervention in Venezuela and the subsequent blockade of Venezuelan oil, supply has been severely curtailed. The US has also threatened to impose punitive tariffs on countries that continue to sell oil to Cuba – which has contributed to further isolating the country. In an attempt to manage the crisis, Cuba's foreign minister traveled to Moscow yesterday for talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin. - Our countries have a special relationship that has developed historically. We have always stood by Cuba in its struggle for independence and the right to choose its own path, Putin said after the meeting. Russia has condemned the actions of the United States and promised continued support to Cuba. Mexico has also sent humanitarian aid in the form of food and hygiene items. President Claudia Sheinbaum has said the country wants to continue helping Cuba and is exploring the possibility of supplying oil without suffering US sanctions. UN warns of humanitarian crisis UN chief António Guterres has warned that the lack of oil risks leading to a serious humanitarian situation. The fuel shortage is already affecting the food supply, transport and healthcare. At the same time, the US has made it clear that the goal is a political change on the island. President Donald Trump has said the Cuban government faces a choice and needs to make drastic changes. The Cuban government has introduced several emergency measures to save fuel, including rationing and reduced public transport. But despite the measures, everyday life is becoming increasingly difficult for many Cubans. Power outages are becoming more and more frequent, transport is being canceled and access to food is deteriorating. In the streets of Havana, the mountains of garbage continue to grow – a visible symbol of a crisis that now pervades the entire society.

ce1fd7826103db80f7f9e7178b7e1458014fbffa: The expert warns: "Completely impossible to determine the avalanche danger"
69e1f59f0941e6a4692086457336f2cba54f9e5e: This season, 99 people have died in avalanche accidents in Europe - so far. It can be compared to the 2024-2025 season, when 70 people lost their lives on the slopes. - You can see that there are very avalanche-dangerous conditions in parts of the Alps right now, and have been recently. Overall, it's a very difficult winter, says Petter Palmgren, avalanche expert at the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency. The fact that there are so many avalanches is due to the fact that it has been both snow-poor and cold. - The snow is very weak. Once new snow arrives, conditions will be optimized for people to trigger avalanches, says Palmgren. Difficult to assess the danger In almost all avalanche accidents, it is people who start the avalanche themselves, says Palmgren. - That is the vast majority. Off-piste skiing or going on a trip beyond lifts and roads and villages and such. Then it happens from time to time that avalanches sweep into areas that should be safe. The weather right now makes it extremely difficult to assess the danger, even for experienced skiers. - The avalanche danger remains because there are such weaknesses deeper in the snow. So even if it's sunny the following days, it's easy for accidents to happen. It is completely impossible to determine the avalanche danger as a temporary visitor, but also very difficult for us who work with it every day. You should think about that. Petter Palmgren's advice to skiing enthusiasts is to simply accept the situation that prevails. - If you go down and see that there is a big avalanche danger, then it is not a day for off-piste skiing at all. fc6eb4415e13cc7150502322b8ec37d5ec085db0: The police's genius stopped the Olympic bomber: "Be lucky"
1dad89b53141daed8277d7f397ea52cc4e362aea: Fires and explosions hit several sports grounds around Stockholm. At the same time, they tried to convince the International Olympic Committee that Sweden was a safe and secure Olympic alternative. But the attacks created concern and headlines both in Sweden and internationally. - We were concerned, of course. It was something we didn't understand what was happening, says Leif Jennekvist in Jakten på sprengaren, on TV4 Play. Several attacks on sports facilities The first attack occurred in May 1997 when the Nacka ice rink caught fire. This was followed by more fires and explosions, including at Lidingö tennis hall and Stockholm's stadium.  Police initially suspected no connection, but as the attacks continued, a pattern began to emerge. - We had thoughts about who could be behind it, but we had no leads at the time.  A decisive gut feeling The day before the decisive Olympic decision, Jennekvist had a stroke of genius when he saw the Olympic symbol Man and Pegasus on a police colleague's shirt.  He suspected that the next attack would be aimed at Millesgården, where the statue stood. Two plainclothes policemen were dispatched and managed to arrest a man with an explosive charge of 4.3 kilos of dynamite in his backpack. - It was lucky, says Jenneqvist about the arrest. The man was later convicted of preparation for serious destruction and arson, but many questions about the wave of attacks remained unanswered. Despite the arrest and the police's efforts, it was not enough to save Stockholm's Olympic dream - and the investigations into the other attacks were finally dropped.

In total, we eat half a million pizzas every day in Sweden. As early as 1947, the Sjöhagen restaurant in Västerås started serving pizza to the 300 guest workers from Italy. Then it took until 1968 before the legendary Bengt Wedholm served pizza at restaurant Östergök and in 1969 the first pizzeria, Pizzeria Piazza Opera, opened its doors in Stockholm. The first frozen pizza was introduced in 1979 and today Sweden is the second best in the world at eating frozen pizza after Norway. The taste panel, consisting of cleaning expert Marléne Eriksson, comedian and actor Isak Löb and food historian Richard Tellström, has tested which is actually the best. They assess appearance, taste and texture. Agree on the bottom line The panel has compared five different Margheritas from five different companies: Lidl, Coop, Ica, Dr Oetker and Tony's. They agreed that Tony's, the only Swedish pizza, was a rock bottom and ended up in fifth place. - This was actually cheese au gratin. A pizza should have melted cheese, but it shouldn't be a hot sandwich, I think. It's not a gratin. It was too much sandwich for me, and no pizza feeling with the tomatoes. It felt a bit pale and half-done, says Richard Tellström. In fourth place was the pizza from Lidl, which Marléne Eriksson only gave two points. - It was very thin. 1623c71f3bb58bb3d786f2da6a180ff1d46a4df6: Longer days and more hours of sunshine are now noticeable across the country. In southern Sweden, the day gets about four minutes longer every day, while northern Sweden gets up to eight minutes of change. But the rapid change of light can lead to fatigue.  - There will be a postponement of the circadian rhythm. We get light at the "wrong" times because we become dependent on electric light, says Arne Lowden, light and sleep specialist. Spring fatigue despite more light According to Arne Lowden, the fatigue is due to the brain not having time to adjust to stable hormone levels during the sudden increase. - We lack the hormone serotonin, which is needed for us to function, we know this affects animals as well. When the circadian rhythm is disrupted, alertness and mood are affected. Going to bed and getting up at the same times is a way to reduce fatigue.  - One reason why we do well is because we have regular times, but the fact that we need to use an alarm clock is proof that many people have a skewed circadian rhythm, says Arne Lowden. "A kind of jet lag" The fatigue during the spring can also be due to other factors.  - The pollen season occurs at the same time and makes us extra tired. We are also activated by light, which means we don't get to bed in time, says Lowden. It is also important to shut out the light completely when the sun rises earlier in the morning. - We don't want sunlight in at the wrong times, that leads to a kind of jet lag in the spring, he says. This is how you can feel better Psychologist Siri Helle believes that winter often brings with it a general depression that usually subsides in the spring. - What has been seen is that there is a seasonal moodiness, even in the spring when it gets brighter. The sleep cycle and lifestyle changes, like how we spend our days and what our expectations look like.  She advises to be alert to feelings that appear and to ask yourself what gives joy and meaning in everyday life. - You have to be kind to yourself. dc9543dd2d29e92aaeafff34e83346ba0875380d: So many children go sledding without a helmet: "Can get brain hemorrhage"
3b83237b1e39570667902f09ecdf723b373e265b:
Children all over the country gather in sledding hills when the snow falls. In Vasaparken in Stockholm, helmet use is common, but not everyone wears a helmet. Many children go sledding without a helmet, even though the risk of head injuries is high. A survey from Trygg-Hansa shows that four out of ten parents state that their children do not use helmets on sledding slopes. There is no requirement for a helmet, but doctors emphasize that protection can be decisive in the event of an accident. Doctors warn of risks In the event of a strong blow to the head, the brain can shake inside the skull. - What happens is that if you hit your head hard, the brain actually shakes inside the skull or inside the skull. And when that happens, you can get tiny microscopic injuries in the brain. Then you can get the symptoms we call a concussion. In the worst case, it could be that you get an injury to the skull bone, that it breaks. And then you can get a brain haemorrhage, says Viktoria Bove, section manager of emergency medical care for children in Solna.  Children's heads extra exposed Children have larger and heavier heads in relation to the body compared to adults. - This means that they have an increased risk in these situations of getting head injuries of various kinds. It is fantastic to go out with the children and enjoy the snow and ice and everything that we have. But it's actually just as fun to go sledding with a helmet as without a helmet. So put your helmet on, says Viktoria Bove. The children themselves are often aware of the risks. The parent Jeanette Gustafsson questions her son, Nilas Gustafsson. - Do you always wear a helmet? 
- Yes. 
- What does mother say if you don't have a helmet?
- Go to the ambulance.
- Yes, then you can go with the ambulance. But can you go sledding if you don't have a helmet?
- No.

The incident is considered an accident. Unusually low water levels The wreck in question is a 40 meter long warship from the 17th century and has become visible due to the unusually low water levels of the winter. The ship has not been wrecked but sunk on the spot, which means that it is relatively intact.  In Stockholm earlier in February the water level was 60 centimeters lower compared to normal levels. Also in other places in Sweden, and throughout the Baltic Sea, the water levels have been record low due to the winter's high pressure. In Skellefteå a full 80 centimeters lower than normal.

The function has been prepared for two years and can be activated in the event of war, conflict or other serious external situations.  - We call, text and use the internet every day and it is important for the authorities to be able to reach out with information, says Minister of Civil Affairs Erik Slottner (KD). Ove Landberg, strategist at the department for preparedness and security protection, explains that the technology is already used when using your phone abroad. In Sweden, the function is used when calling 112. New tool for high alert The measure covers all four national operators: Telia, Tele2, Telenor and Tre. For users, the service is free of charge, but for security reasons it must be activated manually.  - It is to reduce potential risks if very many phones suddenly have to communicate via another network, says Ove Landberg. If the function is activated, a VMA, important message to the public, is sent out. National roaming is one of several measures used in case of high alert and can be activated quickly.  - When preparedness is heightened, the government has a smorgasbord of different tools to choose from, and then the Post and Telecommunications Board makes the decision. If there is maximum preparedness, the operators activate this in principle immediately. Inspired by Ukraine Erik Slottner believes that the changed world situation has made the issue more relevant.  - We have seen in Ukraine how important it has been to stick together during the war and this is crucial for reaching out with information, he says. In addition to Ukraine, Sweden is one of the few countries that has implemented national roaming, as part of strengthening total defense due to the global situation.  - This is financed through defense investments, there is a special pot for this, says Erik Slottner. In the survey for February 2026, Magdalena Andersson (S) continued to have the highest level of trust with 43 percent. Ulf Kristersson (M) follows with 36 percent, then Jimmie Åkesson (SD) on 29 percent and Ebba Busch (KD) on 28 percent.  The distance between Andersson and Kristersson is still statistically secure - but is shrinking compared to January. Confidence in Kristersson increases somewhat and he is now statistically assured ahead of Åkesson.  Ebba Busch increases the most The largest increase is accounted for by Ebba Busch. Her confidence rises statistically by 4 percentage points, from 24 to 28 percent, which means that she is now only one percentage point behind Åkesson. 
 
In the bottom segment, a slight rise can be seen for Elisabeth Thand Ringqvist (C) and Simona Mohamsson (L), who both increase by 2 percentage points. Mistrust is changing In the same survey, mistrust towards Ulf Kristersson drops significantly by 6 percentage points, from 46 to 40 percent. Distrust of Jimmie Åkesson increases by 5 percentage points, from 54 to 59 percent. 

For Elisabeth Thand Ringqvist, mistrust increases by 5 percentage points, from 35 to 40 percent, even though trust is rising at the same time. 

Novus also points to the fact that Ebba Busch received a lot of international attention, including in Davos and in connection with a Gripen campaign in Canada. At the same time, the Christian Democrats lost in Novus' latest voter barometer and ended up under the Riksdag barrier.

ee582e6f70e0666b0cba0c73bb281d97e0ce509c: Helena's cat had an emergency caesarean section: "15-20 thousand more expensive"
e2196d4e41baa07b3d651aa49978256810cb73d2:
She has long experience in dog and cat breeding, but stopped after an emergency a year ago. One of her pregnant cats was unable to wean out the kittens and required a caesarean section. At the clinic, both blood tests, ultrasound and X-rays were required before the operation could be carried out, which led to high additional costs. - I felt that they added thing after thing after thing simply so that the final sum would be higher. Why should you do both an X-ray and an ultrasound, there is no reason. How much more expensive was it? - 15-20 thousand more expensive. More want national guidelines According to the Novus survey, which was carried out on behalf of the insurance company Agria, nine out of ten dog and cat owners want open price lists for veterinary care. Agria is also calling for national guidelines for what should be included in various treatments to avoid unnecessary steps and expensive overtreatment. - My feeling from beginning to end is that this was only about money, says Helena Vikström Roslin
Denies overtreatment Evidensia, where Helena went, says they follow established veterinary guidelines and would never carry out unnecessary treatments to drive up prices. But that prices can still vary. - We have open price lists for everything that can be predicted, but you can never know what is needed until you have had the opportunity to examine the animal and know what is wrong, says chief veterinarian Marlene Areskog. The Swedish Competition Authority investigates transparency The Swedish Competition Authority works on behalf of the government to produce proposals that will strengthen the consumer power of pet owners. A report is expected at the end of next week. Helena Vikström Roslin hopes for change. - It shouldn't have to happen like this. Such costs should not be incurred and there is no need, says Helena Vikström Roslin.

da16db133e74514c2fec195fa933a7618f7cb6e2: Details: Trump is considering eliminating the supreme leader's son
93b759847a620cefa3ec3910a9221a7c6bb9491d: Student protests at several universities in Iran have continued this week, after demonstrations began at the weekend. Clashes with the Basij militia, a volunteer force within the terrorist-branded Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), have been reported. At the same time, the United States continues to build up military strength in the region. On Thursday, the US military reportedly began moving 12 F-22 fighter jets from an air base in Great Britain to the Middle East, according to Israeli media reports based on flight tracking data. US President Donald Trump is said to be considering military options if negotiations with Iran, which are planned this week, fail. It could be "limited" military strikes to pressure Iran into an agreement, according to information provided to Axios.  - No one knows what the president chooses, says a high-ranking official in the White House to the newspaper. Eliminate the supreme leader's son According to the information, several options are on the table, including a targeted attack on the supreme leader's son, Mojtaba Khamenei - and also his father. - They have something for every scenario. One scenario takes out the ayatollahs and his son and the mullahs, the official told the newspaper. 55-year-old Mojtaba Khamenei has been singled out as a potential replacement for the supreme leader. Another source told Axios that a plan to kill Khamenei and his son was already presented to Trump several weeks ago. "The media can continue to speculate on the president's thinking all they want, but only President Trump knows what he may or may not do," White House spokeswoman Anna Kelly said earlier in a statement. A source familiar with the talks told Axios that both Omani and Qatari mediators have told Iran and the United States in recent days that any deal must allow both sides to claim victory and, if possible, also be something the Gulf states and Israel can live with. The US has the largest air force in the Middle East since the 2003 Iraq War.

69b6d70fbb3b320f61916b407df657e6369dff5f: Juholt rages over the deportations of young people: "It's only about skin color"
522be9e2c116cf19145faedcc2691f5348a47bcb: Afnan Agha came to Sweden as a ten-year-old and has since built up his life in Köping. She is chairman of SSU in western Mälardalen and works in care. But now she risks being deported to Iraq – a country she has no connection to. "It's just about skin color" Håkan Juholt is strongly critical of the current policy and believes that it hits young people who are established and contribute to society. - This is not about integration or refugee policy, it's just about skin color. I didn't think I would get to experience that in Sweden, he says in Efter fem. He also points out that Sweden is facing major demographic challenges and that people like Afnan are needed in the country. - It's like saying: gold is a good asset, but we only use gold that is mined in Sweden. It's stupid and inhumane. When racism and incompetence go hand in hand, Sweden runs into the ditch. We need more people like Afnan, not fewer. The change in the law behind the deportation wave The background to Afnan's situation is a change in the law which means that the possibility of a residence permit due to particularly painful circumstances was abolished. The decision was pushed through by the Tidö parties and the Social Democrats. - It is a completely wrong and unfair assessment of such cases, says Afnan Agha. Several high-profile cases have led to political debate and now the opposition, including the Social Democrats, has supported a proposal for a temporary moratorium to freeze deportations while the legal situation is investigated. The proposal will be presented to the Social Security Committee on Thursday, but needs the support of one more party to pass. Afnan Agha now hopes for a change and describes waiting for a new decision from the Swedish Migration Agency as very stressful. - I try to think about it as little as possible, even though it is my destiny.

dd07ed78229945fecda51ec1717650c5e8fe9aca: Details: Little girl brutally raped in asylum accommodation
f63ca6a503f9382f641cf51ecc1f8f5a20d895fc: The police cordoned off the Migration Agency's return center in Märsta, north of Stockholm, earlier in February. It was stated that it was a serious crime, but since then has not wanted to comment anything further. - Unfortunately, our assessment is that we cannot go into what crime we suspect. Due to the confidentiality of the preliminary investigation, it is also not possible to explain in more detail why we cannot go into the classification, says Daniel Wikdahl, press spokesperson at the Stockholm Police. According to information to TV4 Nyheterna, the police were alerted after a little girl came into hospital with injuries. The police started an investigation and suspected that she had been subjected to a serious rape. Information that emerged in the preliminary investigation made the police suspect that the girl was subjected to the sexual crime inside a toilet in the same building as the reception at the asylum accommodation in Märsta, according to sources for TV4 Nyheterna. The site was cordoned off and a technical investigation was carried out. Now, just over two weeks later, still no suspect has been arrested. A prosecutor has been linked to the case and is very secretive. - I will not comment on this case other than that there are no detainees. I will not answer questions in this matter at this time with reference to pre-trial confidentiality and the need to work undisturbed, says Chamber Prosecutor Urszula Grabowska, who leads the investigation. "The family feels very bad" The court documents confirm that the classification is aggravated rape against children. The girl's parents have received legal counsel. - The family feels very bad, says the plaintiff's assistant Melissa Toutounge Aksöz to SVT. The Swedish Migration Agency states that security measures have been taken and, among other things, extra guards have been called in. - After the police intervention at the reception and return center in Märsta, we increased the presence of both our own staff and guards on site at the accommodation. This is for the purpose of creating security for the people who live with us. Going forward, the safety and security of our accommodation is paramount

7d2330821f07aa3a37a422c0b45cb63898692379: Camilla was sick at home - lost 9,000 kroner
cd4200931c45d7dd71a91b4fa9f96db421415d9b: Two bouts of illness in one month resulted in a blow of SEK 9,000 in lost income. Camilla Wanhatalo, 47, works as a medical secretary at Malmö University Hospital and is one of those who cannot afford to be sick at home.  - It doesn't feel good at all. If you're sick, you're sick, and then you want to unwind and take it easy, but that's not possible, we still have to work. It's about the money. Now the trade union Vision wants to abolish the retirement allowance, an issue that, for example, the trade union Handels has pushed for many years.  Every other member works when ill Vision conducted a member survey where almost every other member works when ill, a third of them because it is too expensive to stay at home. - We see a high level of sickness absence and that people cannot stay at home. It is about quite a lot of money every month if you are sick for one or two days. It is approximately SEK 1,100 if you earn around SEK 30,000, as many of our members do. It can be the difference between being able to buy winter clothes for the children or being able to pay the bills at the end of the month, says Veronica Magnusson, union chairman for Vision. Voted down repealed retirement allowance The retirement allowance has also been discussed in the Riksdag. At the latest in November, the Social Democrats' proposal was voted on in the social insurance committee to scrap the retirement allowance. Johan Britz (L), labor market minister, is one of those who stand behind the retirement allowance. - I think we must constantly continue to discuss the work environment and improve it, not least within the contact profession. But abolishing the retirement allowance would be bad for Sweden, our economy and it would be unfair to those who pull a big load every day, says Johan Britz (L). Camilla Wanhatalo herself wants the retirement allowance to go away. - Then people would have stayed at home when you were sick. They had not come here and infected others. I don't think anyone here would have benefited from being at home, she says.

345918fe9a5373fccd17eb20740447ef2eb9e499: The Olympic coup in Cortina – fooled everyone
41bc38f6cca36962001b74b417767c5fbb631430: Federico Corsetti and Giancarlo Folonari, both from Milan, decided to follow in their uncle's footsteps and create their own Olympic adventure. By printing clothes and flags with Mandostan's symbols, they managed to get into several parties and events during the Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina. The idea was born from an old family story. Already in 2006, Corsetti's uncle had managed to trick his way into the Olympics in Turin by pretending to be an athlete from a fictitious country.  - As soon as we heard that the Olympics would take place in Milan and Cortina, we drove there and did the same thing. It was incredible, says Federico Corsetti. Fooled both Boris Becker and Jürgen Klopp The duo says that at first it was difficult to convince people that they were real athletes, but that it got easier each time. They spoke in a made-up language and presented Mandostan as an old Soviet country under the Pamir Mountains in Central Asia. - We had to speak broken English and say: Hi, I'm from Mandostan, says Giancarlo Folonari. With the help of their roles, they managed to trick their way into events where they met famous profiles such as Boris Becker and Jürgen Klopp.  - It was a fantastic feeling. Because we pretended to be athletes, it was like talking to each other as colleagues, says Folonari. Believed to be a terrorist group One of the most memorable moments was when they convinced a Canadian skier that Mandostan really existed - after two hours of talking. However, the adventure almost came to an abrupt end when they put Mandostan's flag on a thirty meter high pole during the Olympics. - It was not a good idea. The fear of terrorist attacks is very high during the Olympics, so they thought it was a terrorist group. But it was just us, says Corsetti.

fe19184e47dfd11a1dba86cda799b3e1cf72a641: The payment giant Klarna cooperates with at least eleven scam shops
124b0a60a60eff891024a2023857774d6600306e:
Yesterday, Kalla revealed the facts that Dutch fraudsters used AI-generated videos with Swedish celebrities to sell miracle pills - capsules that claim to cure cancer and epilepsy, among other things. In the checkout, Klarna was listed as a payment intermediary. Now the tangle is growing.  Klarna has not only worked together with the Dutch fraudsters. The Swedish financial company is a payment intermediary for at least eleven online shops that market products with illegal health promises - this can now be revealed by Kalla fakta.  The online shops violate the Medicines Act and the Food Act - that is what the Swedish Medicines Agency and the Swedish Food Agency assess when Kalla fakta asks questions about the marketing of the products.  Banned - but continues to sell One of the sites is Natural hemp life. The webshop sells CBD oil with claims that the product protects against severe diseases such as Alzheimer's and Parkinson's. Health claims are prohibited. When the Swedish Medicines Agency tried to stop the online shop, the company moved operations to Poland. From there, sales continue – aimed at Swedish consumers. And at checkout: Klarna as a payment intermediary. "Klarna has a huge responsibility" Klarna is registered as a bank and is covered by the Money Laundering Act. This means that the company is obliged to have good customer knowledge - to understand which companies it does business with and what type of business they conduct.
Marie Wallin is a former chamber prosecutor and expert on money laundering. She believes that Klarna's actions may be criminal.  - Klarna has a huge responsibility. They need to understand that they have to be the troublesome gatekeeper against this kind of thing. I think there are conditions for both the Financial Supervisory Authority and the law enforcement authorities to review whether Klarna follows the rules as they should.   Just over a year ago, the Financial Supervisory Authority cracked down on shortcomings in Klarna's customer knowledge. The company received a penalty fee of half a billion kroner. Now new questions are raised. - As a lawyer in the financial market area, I am thinking about whether Klarna has control over all parts of its operations - o
ca633492b3d7cbd12d40ed291ab12533d01ffc55: Reveals his "usual Monday": Red light therapy, PT and skin care
2d985d9ec9131847fd10c5a14508bec6dc357bfe: In "Girls of Stockholm", four of Sweden's biggest influencers show off their luxurious lives. Season two premieres on February 27, and among those who are followed in the series are Lovisa Worge and Hanna Friberg. In Nyhetsmorgon, Lovisa Worge tells us that she enjoys a more routine life, even if it's not as fun to show off. - Our life is very... You have to show the luxurious and it has to be... Or should, many do. But I like this squirrel wheel and going to the office, she says. "There is no ordinary day in my life" Lovisa Worge runs, in addition to her influencer company, two more companies - including one together with her best friend Bianca Ingrosso. When she's not out and about, a typical Tuesday usually involves office work between nine and five. - If I'm at home, it's a very normal everyday life, says Lovisa Worge. She starts the day with a session with her personal trainer. The same PT also trains Hanna Friberg - but an hour before. - I get up very early in the morning. I have a little more... there is no ordinary day in my life, everything looks so different to me, says Hanna Friberg. Her day usually starts with breakfast, red light therapy, News Morning and a skincare routine – and ends with a dinner event. Spreading the content However, this is not all that viewers will see in the new season, with much of the everyday content being saved for their own channels instead. The profiles have separated what appears in the series and what is published in their other platforms. - It gets very boring if you sit in a podcast and tell exactly everything that has happened and then four months later it comes on TV. Then there is no news value, says Lovisa Worge. The most common misconception about influencers, she says, is that they are detached from the world and think that life is like on Instagram. - We have a very good self-distance to it. It's a job and we run a company, says Lovisa Worge.

792133af1938d132261943b2e8f46f1622280672: Micael built his own Vasaskepp - for over 20 years
33f0db3568e3393a289304745121f490482797a4: It was in the early 2000s that Micael Ullerteg, a resident of Algutsrum on Öland, attended a private party at the Vasa Museum. When he sat under the bow of the ship, his eyes were fixed - and the fascination. - I was so incredibly impressed by the ship when I sat there, he says. Shortly after the visit, he bought an extensive kit of the Vasaskeppet, unaware that the model was intended for professionals. The work began at home in the garage and quickly became more time-consuming than expected. The guild alone took ten years to complete. - There are no parts that are simply glued together. Each plank must be soaked, bent over a light and shaped. It's a huge job, he says. "The cowls are wine corks" When the scythe was finished, he temporarily lost the desire to go on the rig. - There are an awful lot of tampers and threads. So I put it aside for a while, says Micael. Instead, Ullerteg began to manufacture figures and details. It turned out to be everything from sailors and blacksmiths to cows and houses along a self-built quay. - The old men are made of toothpicks and matches. The boxes are wine corks. I have used the foil from a kava bottle for buckets. You have to come up with solutions all the time, he says. In the end, there were so many figures that they couldn't fit on the ship itself. - My wife said it didn't work. Then I built a wharf too. And then there were even more details, says Micael. Fatal accident during Idol night One of the few setbacks occurred when he had the TV on in the background while building. - There was a guy in Idol who sang so terribly fake. I stood up, walked towards the TV and backed right into the ship. The stern went into the floor and became splinters. I had to rebuild everything, he says. Despite extensive work, breaks and Idol accidents, he has never come close to finishing the project. - No, I have never given up. I have only built when I felt like it, instead of sitting in front of the TV. It has always been fun, he says. "A special feeling" The last two years were spent on the rig - the part he retired
49dc62ca63ca7b776889b91fb6338e4c7ba582dd: Price slip after the stop: "Will probably be a juicy bill"
55d84f5255757283e0c137f3b65399cd1d471e6a: On Thursday, electricity prices soared in large parts of Sweden. In the south of Sweden, electricity prices rose sharply, with over five kroner per kilowatt hour. The stoppage in one of Sweden's six nuclear power reactors thus comes at a time of already high electricity prices, even if the worst price spikes have subsided now that the cold is releasing its grip on the country. The reactor at Oskarshamn is taken out of operation after an unexpected failure.  - The price will be a little higher, especially in the southern electricity areas. Should it get a bit cold during March, we will continue to be connected to the German electricity prices. We've been doing that for a while now, but it's becoming even more frequent and clearer. We don't get as much cheap electricity from northern Sweden, says Johan Sigvardsson, electricity price analyst at Bixia. Mild weather and wind For many, February's electricity bill will be the biggest for a long time. Meteorologist Ulrika Elvgren gives a forecast for this week's electricity prices and explains how the weather affects it. - The weather has a greater effect than ever. At my house, the electric cartridge has been humming throughout January and half of February, so it will probably be a juicy bill, she says in Nyhetsmorgon. Both temperature and wind affect the price. The temperature controls the consumption and the wind how much wind power you can get out. - What looks favorable in the coming week is that it will be both windier and milder, which will benefit electricity prices by keeping them down a bit, says Ulrika Elvgren. More than half from water Right now the power distribution looks like we get a little more than half of our electricity from hydropower, almost 27 percent from nuclear power and about ten percent from wind power. Wind power will increase now that it will blow more and nuclear power will decrease with the shutdown of the reactor in Oskarshamn. In addition, Formark 3 will enter an audit in March. - You can probably expect that it is above all in southern Sweden that it is more price sensitive. You notice that even during the weekend, although it is quite cheap, it is a bit higher in the south, because of the connection to the continent.
e7a7638100b700af6f8a98ef024a534b9a2a6340: The expert: This is what you do if you are cheated in online shopping
531e7c26c24ce92fb4b124e539c411c19f0503eb: Cold facts revealed this week that the payment service Klarna cooperated with a company that sold fake pills that were claimed to be able to cure cancer and epilepsy.  Despite complaints and several notifications about misleading marketing, Klarna did not end the cooperation with the Dutch company until after Kalla fakta's review.  Right to get money back If a product does not live up to what was promised, you should first of all contact the company you bought from to get a working product or cancel the purchase and get the money back, says Maria Wiezell, consumer advisor at Sweden's Consumers.  - You have the right to that according to the Consumer Purchase Act, she says. If you paid with a credit card or with a service such as Klarna, according to the Consumer Credit Act, you have the right to turn to the credit company if the company does not solve the problem, says Wiezell. - Then the creditor must instead do what the company is obliged to do and ensure that you get the money back.  Important to have proof In order to get the money back, it is important to read about what the product promises. - Unfortunately, the marketing does not always correspond to the reservations that are made in the contract terms themselves. The third step is to turn to the General Complaints Board. Then it is important to have evidence in the form of, for example, screenshots of what the company promised, says Wiezell.  But with some products it is difficult to show that they did not have the promised effect, she adds. - Therefore, in some cases it has been easier to refer to the right of withdrawal.
a5ac0adfe18d8130c982ebde5003bb0a7b484815: Then the African blood rain can sweep in over Sweden
95e2f70a9528cea973241997e17edd0750cb800f: When warm air is expected to flow in over parts of Europe later this week, it will bring with it sand particles from the Sahara, which Göteborgs-Posten first reported on. - It is dust that has swirled up in the atmosphere and then been transported. Now it has followed these deep low pressures to the north, and when it then rains, the sand can fall from the atmosphere with the rain, says TV4 Nyheternas meteorologist Ulrika Elvgren. The phenomenon when the blown sand combines with rain and falls to the ground is called blood rain. - You can see some reddish drops on, for example, the bonnet of the car. It is most visible if it is raining on top of snow, says Ulrika Elvgren. Moving in during Thursday The rain area is expected to move in over the west coast and a little inland during Thursday afternoon - but it is not entirely certain that the rain of blood will be felt.  - It can rain a little bit over Denmark, so that there are not so many sand particles left when it comes over Sweden, says Maria Svedestig, meteorologist at SMHI. Despite the dramatic name, blood rain is therefore harmless - and not entirely unusual either. It happens once a year and is most common on the west coast.
5d872d9d2722fc5eeafb7b5076d59a2c41018fd2: Sabotaged water works: "Not an attempt to harm Sweden"

On the way to the building where the power had gone, the police found plugs thrown in the snow. Inside the building, the light was red and the alarm box displayed an error code. The emergency button had been pressed and the power to the waterworks that supplies all of Västerås with water had gone out.  Walked in - wasn't locked In the police investigation, it appears that the staff at the waterworks were extremely worried about what happened and that a single person had managed to accomplish the whole thing. They couldn't understand how someone managed to cut off the power and the backup generator at the same time.  "They see no other way out than that it is a deliberate action to sabotage a socially important activity and that you know exactly what you are doing and what needed to be done to get the desired effect," the police write in a memo. The surveillance images show how the man pulled a little on a gate and yanked on a door to get into the power station. In the investigation, it appears that neither the gate nor the door appeared to be locked, nor did the man use any tools.  Mälarenergi, which operates the facility, has previously stated that they will review safety.  Wore a Russian cap and talked about submarines The incident happened on the night of January 30 and the following morning the staff managed to restore everything and get the facility up and running again. That same night, the police were also able to arrest the perpetrator near the waterworks. Then he wore a cap with the Russian coat of arms. He told the police directly that it was he who had been inside the power station.  "When the patrol drives the man into the station, he states that he has learned several different languages but that
he regrets not learning Russian. He also states that he would like to go to Russia and study martial arts," the police write in their report. 12aa7271afd342a8fb51c82871e2ba6c73c190ea: The doctor: This is how you avoid common eye problems
5f9f025f34082346b652e4bd1aec53f36a7f63b0: Screen eyes is often called digital eye fatigue and means tired, dry and irritated eyes caused by screen work. Symptoms can be headache, blurred vision and neck pain. It occurs, among other things, because we blink less often. - It is important to have the screen at the right height. If you have the screen a little too high, you are forced to stare more and blink too little. You are so interested in focusing on what you are doing that you blink less, says Bo Andersén. Ergonomics and breaks Sitting correctly and ergonomically is therefore part of the solution. - When you are interested, you like to curl up. You should sit ergonomically, with your shoulders back. Like being out riding. Sway in the back and the screen at the right distance, says Bo Andersén in Nyhetsmorgon. Another important point is to take breaks. There is something called the 20-20-20 rule and it means that every 20 minutes you rest your eyes for 20 seconds on something that is 20 feet (about 6 meters) away. The eyes change with age. For problems with dry, itchy eyes, Andersén recommends starting with terminal glasses in time. So-called presbyopia, or presbyopia, usually occurs at the age of 45 and also affects the eyes. - Then maybe an eye examination is even needed. Some struggle up to 55, but then they probably have a bit more headaches and discomfort, says Bo Andersén. With age, the production of lubricant in the glands in the eyes also decreases. Then you may need eye drops. Then you should examine yourself. Another everyday problem is small things that move around in the eye or in the field of vision, so-called vitreous detachment. It is a harmless age-related change in which the eye's jelly detaches from the retina. - It is extremely common. It's a little scary and you get a little worried, but I usually compare it to the skin wrinkling. You can have small figures in the field of vision and the typical thing is that it follows the movements, says Andersén. It is usually nothing serious, but you should have it examined if it comes on suddenly, or if there are large swarms of dots or lines.
df285aa0ad07e4f934930efbd35d82d0033baa29: Left the gala - after Tourette's exclamation: "Devastated"
693547402be57bc51e479cccb640cb4180cbc1f4: John Davidson could be heard shouting the 'n-word' as actors Delroy Lindo and Michael B Jordan presented an award at Sunday's British Film Awards.  Both actors said afterwards that they took the incident very seriously and the BBC pulled the show from its streaming service because of the incident. "We would like to thank Michael and Delroy for their dignified and professional conduct," the British Film Academy wrote in a statement.  Left gala Coprolalia, involuntary outbursts of foul language or sexual innuendo, is a symptom that can affect those with Tourette's.  John Davidson was there because the film "I swear", which is based on his life story, was nominated and won an award at the gala. He says he chose to leave the salon during the awards ceremony because he realized he was making other people feel uncomfortable. "I have dedicated my life to supporting and highlighting people with Tourette's and to trying to work for compassion, kindness and understanding from others and I intend to continue to do so," Davidson said in a statement.

1bec037db3a7f8c42997496b8a0f3a3b6014174e: Considering alternatives to attack on Iran: "Only Trump knows"
d717c3d6b9d6770f3cf4887ba2342afa6f523af4: US President Donald Trump has been briefed on several possible military options against Iran, ABC News reports citing information. Admiral Brad Cooper, in charge of US forces in the Middle East, presented the options to the president during a meeting at the White House on Thursday. Dan Caine, the US defense chief, also participated, writes the news site.   The briefing took place on the same day that the US and Iran held indirect talks in Geneva on Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs. The talks ended without an agreement, but Iran said "technical talks" will resume in Vienna next week. Israel should strike first Several high-ranking Republicans around the president have suggested in the past week that Israel should strike first, and that the United States should help if necessary. This is what people with insight into the discussions told ABC News. The idea behind the proposal is to avoid the United States appearing as the party that starts a new conflict. Analysts interviewed by ABC News believe the arrangement could also give Republican lawmakers political leeway in an election year, since Trump campaigned on "ending wars, not starting them." At the same time, it is warned that such a strategy risks being perceived as an "Israel-supported coup" in the region. "The media can continue to speculate" White House deputy press secretary Anna Kelly does not want to comment on the information about possible military moves. - The media can continue to speculate about the president's thoughts as much as they want, but only President Trump knows what he will or will not do, says White House Deputy Press Secretary Anna Kelly. According to ABC News, it was still unclear Thursday whether Trump, who their sources say is growing increasingly frustrated with Iran's refusal to accede to his demands to halt uranium enrichment and limit its ballistic missile program, has actually adopted any of the proposed plans.

9911bddc383907d6e9c7c4269d2a161f9c06094b: Warns of new pandemic: "Can't even handle a normal summer"
e445fef0d420eb01fc53555b24ed89f0a8d9f793:
At the end of 2019, most people heard about covid-19 for the first time. Within months it was seen everywhere. In the grocery store, on public transport, at work. And not least in hospitals worldwide.  

- It was a dizzying time. Equipment that was out of date, that was found in some spare warehouse. There were many colleagues from all professional categories who only worked for a few weeks in intensive care. And immediately it was full of patients who were so unbelievably sick, says Ingrid Stubelius, chief intensive care physician at Sahlgrenska University Hospital. Poor preparedness Six years later, Ingrid Stubelius meets TV4 in ICU at Mölndal hospital to talk about her memories of the pandemic. The situation is very different today than it was then. The staff do not have mouth guards and visors on them.  The department is no longer filled to maximum capacity. The patients are no longer young, otherwise healthy people who need ventilators. A calm prevails. The pandemic is over.

But according to the Medical Association, it is only a matter of time before the next crisis comes and then they do not believe that our preparedness is sufficient.

- Are we well prepared? We are not, I would say. Today, care cannot cope with an ordinary crisis, cannot even cope with an ordinary summer, perhaps cannot even cope with everyday life every time. We need to be honest and say that healthcare is underfunded and we do a lot of things that maybe we shouldn't have to do. And we need to focus more on the core business, says Hanna Kataoka, second vice-chairman, Swedish Medical Association. Care needs to practice Care and care are, together with the education sector, the industries where the largest proportion feel that they often or always have too high a workload.

- Healthcare personnel need to practice preparedness. As it stands today, much is about solving emergency situations. There is no room for training on preparedness, says Hanna Kataoka. 

Ingrid Stubelius hopes that preparedness is better than it was before covid-19.

- There are so many points where preparedness broke down during the pandemic. Then hop

65dce0c2e2bb90a77a65ac21a3eaaa562efbcd69: Clinton after the hearing last night: "Had no idea"
02548a98d0169393aff243c09dae61edbd042bd8: Hillary Clinton says she had "no idea" about Jeffrey Epstein's criminality. On Thursday, she was questioned for six hours behind closed doors by the House Oversight Committee in Chappaqua, New York, where she and husband Bill Clinton live. In her opening statement, which she published on X before the hearing, Clinton wrote that she does not remember ever meeting Epstein and that she neither traveled on his plane nor visited his home, island or office. She added that, after the crimes became known, she "like any honest person" has been outraged by what has come to light about the crimes of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. "We asked for it" After the long session, Clinton expressed frustration that the committee chose to hold the hearing behind closed doors. She believed that the process should have been public and that she would have liked to have avoided reproducing the content afterwards. - You could have seen it with your own eyes. We asked for it. It would have been better for the committee and their efforts to gather the information they are looking for, she said.  Demands that Trump testify Hillary Clinton wants Donald Trump to be called to a similar hearing. Democrat Robert Garcia also demands that Trump be heard, but so far the committee's Republican leadership has not taken any initiative in that direction. But on Friday, ex-president Bill Clinton will be questioned. - It will be tougher today. None of them are accused of any crime, but the members of Congress will undoubtedly have many questions for Bill Clinton, especially the Republican ones, says TV4's foreign reporter Filip Jacobson.

d0c9e577b72189fce5f79666a4a284fb70209b42: Taking customers to court - could play with empty accounts
c7840bf3ff65eccaa03da14782735b242e024455: It was on the morning of May 13 last year that something went wrong on ATG Casino's website when a security lock was triggered. Suddenly, games could be played without money in the account and customers with zero kroner in the balance could withdraw winnings via Swish.  Word of the bug quickly spread on social media and players rushed to the platform. Now ATG collects money from players in district courts and via the Kronofogden, after the so-called "bug day".  - We had a technical problem which meant that customers could withdraw money they were not entitled to. Quite quickly we fixed it, shut down the error, and then we ended up in the situation we are in now, says Jan Sonnevi.  In the last month alone, the company has won or settled over 20 civil cases linked to the incident. - They got several chances to pay. We sent reminders, but in the end we had to send them on to the Norwegian Kronofogdemyndigheten, says Jan Sonnevi, casino manager at ATG.  In total, ATG has upwards of 300 claim cases in court from last year and this year, although it is not confirmed that all of them concern the bug.  Turnover increased fivefold On May 16, ATG sent refunds to players who received winnings paid out without coverage. According to reports that TV4 has seen, the turnover on that day was fivefold compared to a normal day. The same judgments also show that the number of new players was 24 times higher. - They know what they are doing, it is money they are not entitled to, but they try to take it anyway, says Julia Axelsson, contract law lawyer.  Hope for a solution There are still a large number of claims that have not yet gone to court. Exactly when the process is over is difficult to say. - We of course hope that it will be resolved as soon as possible. We have no intention or desire to pursue a process against our customers, we want to move on, so I hope it ends as soon as possible, says Jan Sonnevi.

d151970b80272c355e62962e483bb0a51b2c33a7: They want to divide the sports holiday - to avoid the Stockholmers
055268f1f0a1205da2c33cdac1140c928525adff: Split up the sports holiday weeks - to spread the Stockholmers out in the mountains. That is what Kalle Schröder, who runs a hotel in Lofsdalen, suggests.  - My proposal is to break out parts of those who have sports leave in week nine and let them have it in week seven, eight or ten instead. Schröder believes that today's division leads to higher prices and unnecessary congestion in the ski resorts. However, he sees difficulties in implementing the change.  - It could be a problem for families who have children in different schools or parents who work at the school. "The Stockholmers come and buffalo around" Kalle Schröder can imagine that there will be pressure on the ski resorts when all the Stockholmers arrive at the same time.  - Many people from the mountains would probably think that the Stockholmers come and buff around, take up a lot of space, are seen and heard. But there are a lot of lovely Stockholmers too. Magnus Noppa, CEO of the Swedish ski facilities organization, agrees that week nine stands out and welcomes the proposal. He sees that the behavior on the slopes has become more stressed - and that people are less considerate. - I think we see a trend in society as a whole that you come from a stress in everyday life where a lot goes very fast. Then you take it with you when you go on holiday. Has become more expensive According to the comparison service Zmarta, an average ski trip costs SEK 33,000 for a family with two adults and two children in 2026. - The same ski holiday today takes a significantly larger share of the household's finances. Wages have simply not kept up with the lift up to the price peak, says Ola Söderlind, household economist at Zmarta/uScore. Kalle Schröder believes that a change would make sports leave available to more people. The current division is part of a boring social development, according to him.   - It is frustrating. The result is that many friends cannot afford to go and that a large part of the population does not get access to the beauty of nature.

416a159a98d91e057aa55e33d22dfb65a0661d00: Swedes were recruited into the Nazi killer cult
a76a2e7be291e14201379508f9f0fdf4ef90eee5:
A man in his 20s was arrested on Friday on suspicion of participation in a terrorist organization and damage connected to Sweden's security.  Now the newspaper Expo can reveal that the man was the driving force in building up a Swedish branch of the online violent group Maniac Murder Cult (MKU), and recruited members.  The man was arrested and detained on Wednesday. He had then been active in the environments since at least November 6 last year, according to the prosecutor. He has previously been suspected of damage connected to Sweden's security.  Recruitment via social media According to Expo's review, the 20-year-old allegedly ran a TikTok account with the aim of recruiting for a Swedish MKU cell. 

The account is said to have commented on posts from Nordic Resistance Movement activists to profile MKU as action-oriented, writes Expo. Interested parties must then have been forwarded to encrypted chats in Signal and to groups on Telegram.  Expo states that the newspaper had access to parts of the cell's encrypted chats, where a Swedish administrator account is said to have spread violent propaganda, Nazism and terror manuals. In November 2025, the administrator wrote: "Some of you in this chat owe us blood. You know who you are and I'm waiting," according to Expo. The cell states that it is located in five Swedish municipalities. Is singled out as the leader Michail Chkhikvishvili has been singled out as MKU's leader, writes Expo. On New Year's Eve 2023, he planned a mass murder of Jewish children in New York by having a member dress up as Santa and hand out poisoned candy. The plan was stopped by the FBI. He was arrested in 2024 and extradited to the United States in 2025, where he faces up to 40 years in prison. "The outstanding investigative work in this case saved countless lives and underscores the crucial behind-the-scenes activity of our federal law enforcement agents," Attorney General Pamela Bondi said at the time of the arrest. MKU was founded around 2018 in Ukraine by Yegor Krasnov, according to Expo. The head of the preliminary investigation, chamber prosecutor Lars Hedvall, ha
d9157b00b70d3132044cdb83757aa4a39bce4a9c: The police's sharp warning - in the SOS app: "Be careful"
0739035debfdc5e3b66763fafc006c4da23a24f5: During the afternoon and evening of February 25, the police received an unusually high number of calls about fraud and attempted fraud in the Stockholm area.  In total, there are approximately 25 reports of both digital and physical fraud, where the fraudsters pretend to work at a care company - This is an unusually high number. Almost all reports concern crimes in Stockholm municipality, aimed at plaintiffs who are mainly in their 80s and older, says Maryam Zafaranlou, group manager at the Fraud Section in the Stockholm region, in a press release. The wave of reports meant that the police finally issued a warning message in the SOS Alarms app on Thursday evening. "Due to the number of reported fraud attempts on the elderly in the Stockholm region, the police would like to urge elderly people to be careful and not let unknown people in at the door", the police write in the warning and urge the recipient to call 112 in the event of ongoing or recent crimes. "Close the door if something feels wrong" Most reports involve a text message in which the fraudsters claim to work for a home care company that will come and clean the home of the person who is contacted. The person is also asked to call a phone number that is in the text message. When this number is called, the victim of a crime can speak to an additional person who will pick up valuables, money or bank cards at the person's home. The police are now urging victims not to call the number in the text message. - We also want to urge the elderly not to let unknown people into the home and to contact the police immediately if they suspect a crime. Close the door if something feels wrong. The police, insurance companies, banks or other serious companies never go home to collect bank cards, codes, jewelry or other valuables, says Maryam Zafaranlou, and continues: - We also emphasize the importance of talking about how to protect yourself against fraud with elderly relatives and acquaintances.
84a3fa6562b37f8b3b62ebcb5a9143629c1d9ef2: 16-year-old snacks were sold in stores: "You get angry, not sick"
87545b28d566dd4866bd8c35835420f5cb68dc0f:
It was P4 Västmanland that was the first to tell about the life store in Fagersta that sold 16-year-old snack bags. The environmental administration had received a complaint from a customer and then went out to do a food inspection.  The bag was sold with a best-before date of September 2026 – but if you tore off the label, it turned out that the real date was in July 2010. Relabeling prohibited Marie-Louise Danielsson-Tham, professor of food hygiene, explains that it is forbidden to change the best-before date on food.
- It is forbidden to relabel a product with a longer shelf life, she says.

At the same time, she says that it is not illegal to sell goods where the best before date has passed, as long as it is done with the original label. - In that case, I would recommend that they had sold these with the original markings. But on the other hand, who would want to buy 16 year old corn balls? How to detect old snacks How do you know if the snacks are too old?
- Of course you taste them. The first thing that usually happens is that they go rancid, explains Danielsson-Tham. She also advises to pay attention to packaging where labels are pasted on top of the original labelling.
- If you see that something is stuck on a package, then you should be suspicious and ask the store what it is about. Snacks can last for several months According to Danielsson-Tham, it is difficult to say exactly how long snacks such as cheese balls and corn balls last, but they are often edible several months after the best before date if the bag is well sealed. - Months after the best-before date, they should be edible, she says.

c0cf461a58d447c5b316648f2020811cc3432e49: The Tax Agency gives in - after Ulla-Lena's fight: "Finally"
c033808c6cc31f1629f5c9ab912dd84042605514: In connection with Ulla-Lena Lindqvist becoming a widow, she bought a summer cottage in Vidja outside Stockholm. But in 2023, unknown people began registering at Ulla-Lena's cottage - hundreds of people who have no connection to the house. Ulla-Lena turned to both the police and the Tax Agency, but at first she got no help there. In the end, she sued the state for violation of the European Convention together with the Center for Justice. In connection with that, Finance Minister Elisabeth Svantesson (M) was called to the tax committee and announced that she would discuss a solution with the Swedish Tax Agency. Two months passed and nothing happened - until now. "Happy news" Today, Ulla-Lena received an apology from the Swedish Tax Agency together with the message that all unauthorized persons at her address have now been removed. - It is a huge relief that they have finally acted. Now I can finally enjoy my cabin again. But I don't want anyone else to have to go through this, so the Swedish Tax Agency must find a solution for everyone affected, she tells TV4 Nyheterna. Ulla-Lena's representative Fredrik Bäärnhielm Thorslund at the Center for Justice describes it as happy news. - It is a clear receipt of what we have been saying all along: that this problem can actually be solved, if you choose to add the mane. Now we hope that the Swedish Tax Agency will go ahead and also help the many others who have been affected by fraud in a similar way as Ulla-Lena, says her representative Fredrik Bäärnhielm Thorslund at the Center for Justice. The lawsuit against the state, run with the help of the Center for Justice, continues. 20,000 complaints – every year Ulla-Lena Lindqvist is not alone in being affected by incorrect bookkeeping. The Swedish Tax Agency annually receives around 20,000 complaints from people who have discovered that someone else is registered at their address. - For Ulla-Lena, it is a clear problem that many people subscribe to her address and use her summer cottage as a mailbox for criminals. After consultation with the government, Jakob Granit will instead become director general in the Government Office and will leave his current position tomorrow, February 27. Sida's chief executive officer Hanna Hellquist will be interim director general until further notice. An official replacement will be recruited. Sida tells TV4 Nyheterna that they found out about the news very recently and that they have nothing to comment on. Development Minister Benjamin Dousa's press secretary Jakob Zeiler also does not want to give any comment, other than that the process has gone right. Internal criticism There has long been criticism of Jakob Granit from the authority's employees. According to an employee survey that DN reported on this spring, the staff had low confidence in both him and the management. According to information given to TV4 Nyheterna, there have been differences in Granit's and the board's views on how the authority should be governed. Jakob Granit took office as director general of the Swedish Aid Agency on September 1, 2023. Johansson (S): The government closely controlled Sida in an extremely corrupt way Morgan Johansson, the Social Democrats' foreign policy spokesperson, writes in a comment to TV4 Nyheterna that the resignation is surprising and that he wonders what is behind it. "It is well known that the government has controlled the authority in detail in an extremely corrupt way, alien to Swedish administrative tradition. For example, the government pushed for the now infamous payments of bribe money to the relatives and acquaintances of the Prime Minister of Somalia.
Another noteworthy event is when the government this year demanded that Sida pay out millions of kroner to SD's "aid organization" Hepatica, even though their applications did not measure up.  It cannot have been easy to be DG for Sida under those circumstances, and perhaps he has now simply had enough.”

ad4b79a872c2ba70493b1cc3cc2e95d599fbcf8e: The pike got stuck in Johan's son's hand - under the ice: "Panic"
2d03c862946ac07521f29e4cc882029615440a9f: A fishing trip on Mälaren's ice quickly became an unpleasant experience for Johan Bertlid and his son Arvid. They were going to fish for perch but managed to get a pike on the hook. The fish had gotten the hook in the side and could not therefore be brought up through the hole in the ice. - Then I first thought that we should drill a hole next to the old one. But then Arvid thought it wasn't necessary, we had done that before. Then he ran his hand down there, but the ice was so thick. Just as the hand came down, the pike was there, and then the hook was in the hand, says Johan Bertlid. They were about a kilometer out on the ice and fought for over ten minutes to get Arvid's hand up. Johan's youngest son Bo finally drilled seven holes around Arvid's arm. - So we got the whole lump of ice, Arvid's arm, the bait and the pike, says Johan Bertlid. Still have problems with feeling in the hand In retrospect they can laugh about the incident but in the moment it was panicky. - So hopefully people can learn that you should bring a grappling hook or make bigger holes and absolutely not go out yourself if you have to land the fish in that way, says Johan Bertlid. - He has problems with sensation in his thumb and index finger.  They threw the pike back into the lake and they are not afraid to go out fishing again. - We are going out today, as soon as it stops raining.
049d36c5e0140d88545fa7a82fb07ecbb23c935b: Smart trick in the mountains: This is how you fool the thief - in two seconds
f137f013bb779c1adb88dcc59b4ca67be02ad2bf: The sports holiday week is here - and with it, many families with children are on their way to Sweden's ski resorts. When pressure increases on slopes, restaurants and accommodation, more opportunities are also created for thieves to attack expensive ski equipment. Paul Pintér at Stöldskyddsföreningen believes that the problem is not necessarily that more thefts occur - but that the sports holiday means more opportunities for the thief, something that P4 Gävleborg also previously reported on... - The opportunity makes the thief. The more people moving on the slopes and in the restaurants, the more chances to grab something that is unattended, he says. Simple changes Pintér describes how the behavior of skiers changes when they get to the mountains. Many become less vigilant – precisely because everyone else seems to be too. - There are many people who think "no one will take my things". You see jackets hanging everywhere and skis stacked outside the restaurants. But when there are a lot of people on the move, you can get rid of things very quickly. It is easier for a thief to hide in the crowd than when everyone is aware, he says. Expensive gadgets attract thieves Once thieves strike, the target is clear: equipment that can be resold. - Nice, new, expensive skis. Something that has a good resale value. They are the most attractive, says Pintér. Even ski jackets and other equipment can disappear when left unattended in drying rooms, closets or on hooks. The super tip When it comes to actually preventing the skis from being stolen, there's a trick Pintér keeps coming back to - and it stands out precisely because it's so simple. - If you have to leave your skis unattended, tie your skis together with someone else's. The thief wants a complete pair. If they only get a mismatched pair, they can't sell it on, he says. Pintér emphasizes that the trick is not only effective, but also ridiculously simple – so simple that many people don't even think about it. - It's such a simple thing, he says. 5075aa843600eec1b8613d36495ce7acab7f6876: Shortly after three o'clock in the afternoon on April 15, there is an alarm about gunfire in central Eslöv. It turns out that a man has been shot inside a residence, and another man out on the street. Both suffer life-threatening injuries but survive. A witness captures on film how the shooter fires three shots in the street. Police technicians later find 13 empty shell casings at that location. Dna on scooter The person leaves on an electric scooter and a few hours later the police find a similar scooter in a nearby park. It is immediately suspected that it is the getaway vehicle and two days later the handle is checked for DNA and sent to NFC in Linköping. The police request priority from the NFC, which means that it must be prioritized before other cases. However, priority or emergency right-of-way is not requested, which can be done if it is deemed particularly urgent.  In the case of urgent priority, answers must be provided within ten hours, in the case of priority, answers can be delivered within a few days, according to NFC. It is not possible to say that it is always done in a certain case, but serious violent crimes where there is a hunt for a perpetrator, they are often seen in these foretours, says Thomas Johansson, press spokesperson for the police in the South region. The priority requested is determined after discussion with the pre-trial investigation manager and the local forensic department in the region, he says. Exactly what was the basis for the assessment in the Eslövs case is difficult to answer due to pre-trial confidentiality. We can't always go in with priority right of way, but you have to make careful balances and assessments about what the conditions are and how it affects, says Johansson. But we always want to be able to seize immediately if we had to decide for ourselves. The previously doomed NFC's response from the topping came on May 6, barely three weeks later. The result was a match in the police DNA register on a previously convicted 21-year-old. When it arrived, he had already been arrested for the triple murder.
